uRuEMQsPx3kEUEWAnKc0PQ.text: Great drink menu and bartenders! Pimento cheese app is a great to snack on and share. Cool location and great vibe.

egbbWvaax1uNxyaqz_j52g.text: Ok, I waited to try this place until I had a group of people because the atmosphere looked awesome and WOW! I wish I didn't wait...they had an awesome healthy berry something salad that I ate while I drooled over my boyfriend's chicken and dumplings. Both were delicious!! Service was amazing and the ambience was finally what I've been looking to recreate from my missed days in NY....great place to meetup with friends, thank goodness Leroy's made it to Southend!! We really needed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

eGr-UMGUOPd6ybKhmHKwKQ.text: Came here on a Monday afternoon for lunch and was very pleased with the fresh and delicious food! This place brings a modern feel to comfort food and was very affordable and delicious. There's something for everyone on the menu.

f_c51NVd-uX4sETnStjLig.text: One of my favorite spots on the light rail trail! Great cocktails (champagne mojito or berry mule), tasty wraps/salads (berry almond salad), and sweet potato tots are always a great go-to side or shared item. Call ahead for weekend seating, but it's nothing too crazy.

25RZmmUzXZD4nFgErTF-rg.text: Let me set the scene real fast before I discuss the food: this location doesn't serve brunch yet, the environment is gorgeous and the servers are very nice. My friend, husband and I all sat at a booth, where we literally watched the bartender stand and talk with his group of friends for the entire 1.5 hrs of our visit (I'm not sure how the female bartenders could stand it? I'd hate to think he's a manager). While I'm all for a good time, I'd highly doubt his boss would have been pleased if he had heard what we did. An entire 15 minute conversation where he loudly discussed last night where he was stoned (I almost wrote the details of his story but I think it would mortify the business and he'd possibly lose his job... I will leave it at "Pineapple Express") Not the classiest. The food was good.. Mac n cheese was the best along with the fried zucchini. The flavors were all pretty good but I'd recommend they don't run out of two sides (sweet potato tots and potato wedges)on a Sunday lunch. Overall I'd go back to try it for sure... and hopefully the staff is all actually working when I do.

QZafnkREFXS9sVCgDNTUlw.text: Our server was friendly but very slow. We ordered the family style chicken dinner. It was an hour before it came out. The chicken was fried too hard (unless that's their style). The meat was moist, but the outside was near-burnt. The sides (macaroni and green bean casserole) were meh. We ordered 2 cocktails and neither were at all what we expected. As if that wasn't enough, the food ran right through us. It wasn't a pleasant experience and I'm very disappointed. My expectation was higher especially given the reviews. I normally don't write reviews, but this experience was awful and the aftermath  even more so.

OjqSi31BAGrB5HHSy1UEgA.text: The only thing better than the sweet potato tots is the great service and sick atmosphere  We sat at the bar and Tiffany was amazing!

Y54bAqIrAOT07rjKX3IFXw.text: Great food, drinks and atmosphere, but the service is extremely lacking. First visit was for Sunday brunch and then another time for dinner. Both times we had to flag down other servers to place drink orders, appetizers were forgotten and then brought out after the entrees, and the manager never stopped at the table once either visit. Definitely seems to be the norm after seeing the other reviews.

jayi-O2MH3Qhy0uUj29lew.text: We came the day after their soft opening. Food was delicious. No specials at the time but I think that it will eventually happen. We came again on the next Sunday. Wings, pimento cheese and potato wedges are delicious. Staff is super friendly but as they just opened I would recommend to have patience. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Unique seasoning and delicious.
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blueberry smash. Not too sweet and minty.

Xju-FAUSPoAO-aYPqP03Ng.text: We always dine in service is excellent and food surpassed that 9/10 visits there. I bring all of my out of town guests here it's that good and consistent!! The Brussels sprouts are a must try if you don't know what to get

92m1H5vjuDYU6AZ4VHNv5w.text: Great atmosphere and service! Ordered pimento cheese dip appetizer and southwestern salad, my fiance got the chicken club wrap with sweet potato tots. Everything was delicious and came out in good time. Great selection of local beers on draft. Definitely will come here often being directly across the street.

Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese dip with pita

iYzjzPbKybKnU8h9cTMETQ.text: Meh. After waiting for a very long time - long enough that we moved indoors as we got cold outside. I was expecting amazing food, and we got food that was good-enough. Slightly overcooked chicken tenders, cheesy grits where the cheese is lazily sprinkled on top, burger was solid but nothing amazing.  The drinks were appreciated by those who were drinking.

pAe-R4zhI_bHZjVBIYy-PQ.text: Food was bomb, specially the Mac and cheese. There was a huge party before me and my date so it took a little bit for us to get service however the manager saw that we were waiting and he stepped right up and got our drinks in. After that the server was right on point with everything. Will definitely be coming back !

ekjk1rQPRnMfKETUtRkNiw.text: Delicious food and unique drinks! I love how every drink has a play on words for its name. Inside decor was very nice and the bathrooms were spotless. Their fried chicken is amazing and their honey mustard is so sweet and tangy. I got the "wrinkle in thyme" cocktail, I would recommend this drink! Overall great experience, we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wrinkle in thyme cocktail

_altyX7FGlnu4Y74wyHSaA.text: Adam Gautreau is so personable and the drink recommendations are fantastic. Awesome drinks and awesome prices. Amazing patio.

06bAi2GYI-OS8deehpiO9A.text: Turner and the food will change your life in the best way possible. That's really all I need to say. 600 stars.

UquF8SGIbP4LIi_lftujrQ.text: First time at this location and I know they are new but service wasn't great.  I've been to the Cotswolds location and been pleased with their service but not the case with this location.  We were a party of 3 that came in for drinks, a dark and stormy was ordered and should of know when the server looked a little confused with the drink order that we should of stuck to the cocktail menu.  The dark and stormy that was brought to the table looked pretty but the taste was horrible.  They had used Meyer rum over goslings which as a rum drinker made a big difference to the drink and it just sat at the table with the ice melting in it.  Our server never cleared our table and didn't ask about the drink which just soured the experience and we were charged for the drink.  But the cocktails we did order off the menu were good.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. The first in flight and the cucumber basil lemonade.

ojKtw_bCYhhVVbN8uaEYxA.text: I've been to the Cotswold location a few times but never to this one. We went on a Saturday afternoon and the wait was over an hour! It was so packed! But the restaurant is large and we sat at the bar until a table opened up and it was only about a 30 minute wait. The drinks were wonderful, the service great, the food was just ok. It wasn't horrible, but just wasn't a huge wow factor for me. The pretzel app and pimento cheese was delicious. I had the buffalo chicken sandwich and tasted the shrimp and grits. The best thing on that menu is the Mac and cheese. A must have for any location!!

0UEQYxdUDY0zhtD4hAe63w.text: We come here a lot since it's close to our house. The pretzels are so so good! I always like to just get to those and have a few drinks. It's a good atmosphere. Not sure if they do anymore, but used to have a weekly special for sangria. Went last night for the sangria and after we ordered, the server came back and told us the bartender didn't know how to make it. Odd since there was a weekly special for it not too long ago, and also it's a very popular drink. Is there only one bartender? Can google not be used? We had to order something else. Was very disappointed in the service surrounding this.

4t_kBIp7vawN975Cd5hvWw.text: Great southern food in a neat area. We had the Chicken Fried Chicken and Shrimp Wrap. The best sides were the Mac n Cheese and the Mashed Potatoes with Sausage Gravy. Cool ambiance and the cocktails looked good.

VrezbWyaUZeHBabpCvpHyA.text: This place is amazing!! And the food is outstanding!!! Great portions and exceptional customer service.

e5jRuCoEkmjH23AzGDW3Tw.text: The place itself is really cute. I've been here twice both on Sunday's. The first time I went to a larger group and had the black bean wrap for brunch. It was good just dry. The second time I went in with a friend who was visiting he had the fried chicken which he said was really good and I had the berry salad. The service is good they tell you up front they fry the chicken when it's ordered so it takes about 20-25 mins. However I ordered the Berry salad and I didn't want the chicken and I was still charged the same 15.75 for the salad without chicken. Prices should be made different when you take off one of the most expensive items on the dish. Many places in charlotte do that. So basically I paid for it even not having it. Other than that I like this place.

U8V5DO1gh2RrTpTv8chmFw.text: Food was pretty delicious. The mac'n'cheese side was most notable. It was delicious but almost TOO cheesy!   I had a Local brew by Sugar Creek that was refreshing and crisp. I ordered a fried chicken sandwich and the mac'n'cheese side and was unable to finish. The sandwich was good but needed a sauce to make it more moist.   Service was slower than expected at 2:00pm on a Tuesday afternoon but the patio was nice for a warm fall day. I think we will return for the cheesy goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

cQR2u2l87OHe1e8E2kD2IA.text: Went to Leroy Fox for the first time for my daughter's graduation lunch. We had already waited over an hour at Tupelo Grill and called ahead to Leroy to ensure we could get fast service. We were assured that service would be quick. We were seated and had to wait over an hour for food. We watched others get seated 20 or more minutes after us and their food was promptly served soon after they arrived. They were not even busy. When our food was finally served some of the plates were cold and had to be sent back. Our server was nice but didn't seem to have any help. The food was good, I had a salmon salad that was nicely cooked, buffalo cauliflower was delicious. When we got ready to leave I asked the bartender for a to-go cup of ice, one of our guests was sick from allergies and she looked at me with disgust and didn't even slide the cup to me. She sat it in a corner and walked off. It's disappointing to spend so much money on food and beverage to only be treated poorly in the end by staff that don't appreciate their jobs. I brought a party of 15, and could've took my business elsewhere where it would be appreciated.

tSqg-HZSQD9cpBedRXuvdw.text: Wow dynamite place and impeccable food! Great, friendly service. Shout out to their chef Fernando and Sarah! A must stop place in south end!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

kEzWRChX1II88lEEslXZmA.text: Don't order takeout. They tell you a time and don't process order until you show up. Which makes it pointless for you to call ahead

Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Spread. Meant for two
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. First in Flight with a high globe ice cube. Thought that was dope

GeSpKAUw8UnRBclUhjQ-qg.text: Eek - what a disappointment. I was so excited to try this restaurant after I saw what a cool atmosphere it has. I went in already thinking I would love it and left so utterly disappointed.  I would still rank atmosphere a 5/5.  Food, service, experience was all a 1/5.  The food was just terrible. Nothing tasted good. Chicken tenders were honestly disgusting, the pretzel bites were 100% pulled from a freezer, the fried zucchini was nothing special and too big of slices to enjoy. Our server was really trying but just failed all together. He was running around constantly but forgot our water and silverware numerous times. The drink menu was fun and different but honestly just very overpriced. Really bummed out.

INmjAdSmTjF7LKapwnPkqg.text: Love this place! The atmosphere is amazing. Love the music, the food is great. My favorite is the Salmon Salad. So refreshing and their cocktails are pretty great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Salad

ss-lKnA7jzpdpHc1jZJXKQ.text: Met a group of friends for a birthday dinner.  I've been to Leroy Fox's Cotswold location, but this was my first visit to South End.   With a group of 14, the wait staff managed to make is feel as if we are the only ones there. The dinner happened to be the same day as National Margarita Day !! The silver fox margarita was on the sweet side, but mellowed out once I added a squeezed lime. I will add that although I didn't taste the tequila in the drink (I'm a tequila snob), I felt it afterwards!   Not particularly hungry, I ordered the chicken tenders. I know, I know not the most extravagant item on the menu, but oh well! They were hot and crispy! I added a wee bit of salt and was pleasantly content. The ranch dressing was a prefect pairing. The mustard sauce was a little pungent and took away from the flavor of the chicken tender. Thanks to KTs birthday, a local gent bought us a few shots and beers! It pays to have gorgeous friends! I'll definitely return to both locations and expand my palate.

L_c3DwBjbVoXRrNgg2nCKg.text: Hot damn! This place is great! What's the best part? Our server, Silas! He was as attentive as a hawk on a rodent. I've never felt more taken care of in my life. He was as caring as a nanny watching a baby with autoimmune disorder. When our water got low, he refilled our glasses faster than a criminal running from the cops. If my fiance left me for Silas, I'd be upset, but I'd understand.   The food was also really good!

7pH8w89B1GrB_TCPjvHryw.text: Yes!  I will be coming back!!  The decor is so awesome and unique.  The food is amazing and full of flavors and their cocktails are so refreshing.  The waiter was a little young and off his game, but we were able to recognize his spaciness and manage him accordingly.  There is an inside or outside option to dine.  If you sit outside, it is completely covered so you aren't uncomfortable with too much sun.  The bar is awesome too if you want to sit there.  They have TVs playing also!  We didn't make a reservation but were seated immediately.  Being a vegetarian, I was concerned about what they had to eat for me.  I was surprised to discover they have a wrap that turned out to be something I now crave daily.  I would make one suggestion, they should offer some sauce on the side to put on the wrap to add some flavors.  I used the salad sauce from my friend's salad on my wrap and it was sooooo good!!!  I also got a side of the green bean casserole and it also did not disappoint.  The cheese was delicious!  I will certainly be back for round two very soon.  I'm glad our funny bus tour mentioned that this was a great place to eat, because we are so happy to have experienced this exceptional dining experience for ourselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

MXuKApOqWy2SP5m75s_tPA.text: Our al fresco dinner for four was a nice experience.  Food for all of us was excellent and the service from (Sara) was professional; the right balance of patience, attention, and distance.  Pimento cheese app was creative; salmon was cooked to our liking - just a bit rare.  Shrimp po boy was also good; adequate shrimp and roll was fresh.  (Owner, think about an oyster option,  and also use a long roll vs. the ciabatta)  Mac was also done correctly.  All food was fresh and quality.  Would go back for sure!

1Ao0wo-lnUpdv9kcHbEcCg.text: So this was my second time coming to this location and I will give it a 3.5. The first time service was ok but this last time it was lacking. He started off strong and then he was just blah. A friend from out of town ordered the chicken & waffles and it usually comes with an apricot compote. Me and a friend were telling her how good it was on it so she ordered it. When her food came out, there was no compote. After waving down our waiter she asked him about it, he just responded "oh we're out of that" and walked away. Not sure why it wasn't communicated when ordered or once he knew but then was just very uncaring.  I ordered my fav the Zucchini fries love them with the boom boom sauce and I tried something new with the honey buffalo chicken sandwich. It was good, enjoyed the pickled green tomatoes on it! I love the setup in the location with the outdoor patio and the huge bar in the middle of the restaurant and the food is always good but I'll stick to going to the Cotswald location for the better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

jHy_5Q7Rw1XL_fyqhohLVw.text: I am blown away by the number of stars this establishment has.   I was getting together with a few friends last night and they picked Leroy Fox South End, being new to the area, I was excited to give this place a try. I've heard the decor is trendy and cozy but the food isn't anything to write home about. With that being said, I tried to go in with an open mind, but now I understand why I was given such stark reviews from the get-go.  Walking in, I wasn't instantly greeted and waited at the host stand for 5 minutes before I was acknowledged. Finally, I was whisked away to a booth.  Again, it took several minutes of awkward sitting and waiting until our server greeted us and brought us water. Without an introduction, or note of specials he left and didn't come back for what felt like 20 minutes. We didn't order until 8:15 and I arrived at 7:30. This seemed very strange. Other tables seemed to be getting rather good service, so I don't know why we weren't.   The grub: +Meh. This is a disaster area for a vegetarian. Sure, there are fish options, but no tofu, sweet potatoes or just general no meats.  +One saving grace- sweet potato tots. These things were like little balls of heaven. They melt in your mouth and there is a subtle hint of cinnamon! YUM! +White Wine- served at room temperature. NOPE.  The final straw that broke the camel's back was the check game. I had to request the check and 10 minutes later our server came back with checks for us. Awesome. I paid cash. My total was $12.99 and I left $15. Typically if I leave enough with tip, I say something along the lines of,  "I don't need change" or "the rest if for you." Well, I had a few singles and I was assuming (if it was a good server) I'd get change. Nope. He never came back with my change, so that was his tip. Honestly, I wasn't planning on leaving more because the service was so horrendous anyway.   TL;DR: abysmal service, too loud for a conversation and not very veggie friendly. Will I be back? NOPE.

VF0_ZZL7YTvFfT_IyJisEg.text: The best cocktails and bartenders. I was there a few days ago and enjoyed every minute of it!

yjRM6WVFG2SKvs9ZLB3EsQ.text: The food and drinks were delicious!! Had brunch here and loved it. Service was great can't wait to go back!

5Nifd2UMK6a2izAZa7f7Pw.text: I was really blown away by Leroy Fox! I'd only ever gotten drinks at the Cotswold location, and I have to give this South End location two thumbs up on atmosphere, food, and of course their signature drinks.  First off, I've FINALLY found a place to watch sporting events that isn't too much of a "sports bar" that only serves nachos, wings, and domestic beer. Some friends and I gathered to watch rivalry week football games, and it was an awesome environment! Huge TVs, hopping 360 bar, and they seated us in a half-circle booth so we could all face a TV.  I'm so in love with watching sporting events here now because of the delicious food. I greatly appreciate when a restaurant known for it's fried chicken has banging vegetarian options as well. I had their southwest salad with blackened shrimp and their house pineapple-sriracha dressing. Delicious! They also had some of the most perfect potato wedges I've ever seen (not greasy, crispy outside, thick cut), and really good sweet potato tots. Thanks friends for letting me try your stuff. The wraps everyone else ordered also got rave reviews.  I really loved the ambiance of everyone hanging out on a Saturday night. It felt like a neighborhood joint with great decor, friendly staff, and good cuisine on top of it all! Will definitely be back.

xz2hiWRWFIvUypLULjQPSg.text: My wife and I were looking for a place with a fun atmosphere and good food. We found it! There were people of all ages. It was a little loud, but that was to be expected. Our server, Derek, was excellent. My wife enjoyed his beer recommendation. He had great recommendations and his recommendations were spot on. We had the fried chicken. We tried both the "home style" and "buffalo" style. Derek said he preferred the home style and my wife and I agreed. The home style was crispy on the outside and tender and juicy within. The buffalo style was good with the right amount of kick, but we definitely recommend getting the home style. The Mac and cheese was creamy and delicious! The Brussels sprouts with bacon - a dish my wife and I love to cook - we're ok. They could've been cooked a little longer. We had the bread pudding for desert - it came out looking better than the picture. The tables on each side of us asked us what we got as it looked sooo good ... and it was!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trying a new spot in CLT with my honey!

_4ld6lxsQvxiXk3JJZ3fXA.text: Great spot for brunch on Sunday. Was extremely packed this go round but food is always good. We waited so long for the food I forgot to take a picture. But overall great spot and service is also great.

D9XPitxjXkA9UUq2tF0JmQ.text: Poor service. Warm/cloudy beer. Messy bathroom. We were riding the light rail and decided to stop in for a beer and maybe an appetizer. We had to wait to the bartender to get off of her phone...then received two warm/cloudy OMB beers. So we returned those and received two not as warm Sugar Creek beers. I went into the bathroom to wash my hands and there were paper towels towering over the trash can and spilling onto the floor. The staff didn't look too happy, so we decided not to order food after all.

DD39PBxo42ZCX4wdHtsvHA.text: To my surprise this location was much better than my last encounter with Leroy Fox. I was hesitant on trying this one due to the food not being so great when i went to the one by SouthPark. However, I was invited for a birthday brunch and thought this would be a good time to try it again. We had a large party about 30 people we got there early and the staff was very professional and made sure we were seated in a decent time after setting up the tables. The server Ashley was pretty on top of things and I know it was a lot so i give her my kudos. I started with a mimosa but two drinks caught my eye the champagne mojito and another drink called for whom the berry trolls. I chose the berry trolls which was a tequila mix with honey jalapenos and cake with a jalapenos infused ice shell. It was surprisingly better than I thought but that jalapeno spice may be one I pass on. Next time I will aim for the champagne mojito. For food, I ordered the Sadie Mae omelette with a side of hash brown casserole. The omelette was very good but overloaded with gruyere cheese and the hash brown tasted like it was mayo based or possibly sour cream I guess. Either way it decent breakfast food but I may order something different next time. The ambiance was really nice though a lot of TVs everywhere and very casual and welcoming. The shrimp and grits looked good too and is going to be on my list for next time.

XQ43B22vAMg7GxbJioAYQw.text: All three times I've been here I have received the slowest service. You wait to be seated, greeted at the table, drinks, order and food delivery.  It's a busy establishment but not worth the hype.

6pqsevIE3Fr-wd5jy7FQcw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I've tried various things on the menu, a few drinks, and been at different times during the day so I can say that's it's always good food and great service.
