Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

mZJq_CgcG06Xwkf2BoK21w.text: I love a quaint restaurant, I love fried chicken, and I love staff that makes you feel like you are a regular. That's Leroy Fox in a nutshell. Now I'm a fried chicken connoisseur and yes I know about Price's and the S Blvd gas station. Oh yea, Publix chicken too. But for a crunchy, juicy, piece of chicken I go to Leroy Fox. They have a dish called the 1/4 North that comes with a side, I recommend the brussel sprouts or mac and cheese. Put it with their honey hot sauce and you will be sure to thank me later. They have two locations but the South End location is my go to. There's street parking but you've got to search sometimes for a good spot. Doesn't matter because the food is worth it. If you need a good appetizer, try the zucchini fries or the pretzels. I'm literally craving this as I type.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

CeBpz9lk526-cCeRklhkDA.text: We've been to this location two times and have had a pretty good experience both times.  I will say that the service the second time was much slower than the first.  We have tried the chicken club wrap, BBQ chicken sandwich and the chicken fried chicken.  The chicken club wrap is very good and I do really like their honey mustard.  The bbq chicken sandwich was super messy and had way too much sauce on it - would ask for this on the side next time.  The chicken fried chicken was good - the gravy was tasty.  We have tried the sweet potato tots, green bean casserole, and macaroni and cheese.  The sweet potato tots are good - slightly sweet and very good with the honey mustard.  The mac & cheese is great here, probably my favorite side.  The green bean casserole is topped with fried onions and is delicious.  Overall, good food but service can be improved on.

L9CiiZCrzm8ygG9C5IL2ag.text: I've been wanting to try Leroy Fox for a while, so I was really excited when they finally opened a location closer to me!   We went for lunch and were seated right away. The waiter gave us good recommendations. We got the Chicken Fried Sandwich and the Honey Buffalo Sandwich. It seems like they still have some kinks to work out because they forgot the gravy for the Chicken Fried Sandwich and they forgot the blue cheese for the Honey Buffalo Sandwich. They corrected the problem and both were delicious. The Honey Buffalo Sandwich had a bit of a kick. The Chicken Fried Sandwich was my favorite! I would have loved more gravy on it, it was so good. We got the mac and cheese and sweet potato tots as our sides. The mac and cheese was definitely the star of the show. It was some of the best mac and cheese I've had in the south. The sweet potato tots were good too, but they are pretty sweet (rolled in honey, etc), so the mustard on the side was necessary.   For dessert we tried the banana pudding, the bread pudding, and the toffee tollhouse. The banana pudding was pretty good, but I've had better. It needed more bananas for sure. The waiter knew that I didn't like chocolate after I asked about another dessert, but he failed to mention that they put chocolate sauce all over the bread pudding, so that was kind of annoying. I heard nothing but great things about the toffee tollhouse.   All in all, it was a great meal and I would say the best fried chicken I've had in Charlotte so far (still need to try Haberdish and the Shell gas station). We'll definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Fried Sandwich (minus the gravy that came out later)
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Buffalo Sandwich (minus the blue cheese crumbles that came out later)

xMRPCKhKYTI4Jbm0KBBI-g.text: The food was awesome. I had the salmon BLT with cheese grits. The salmon was savory. I'd highly recommend this option, even though they're known for their chicken. The ambience is also very sleek and great for a good date night.

oayJL7PYyMjsDGIBLfjRKg.text: I met my daughter for lunch and unfortunately it was a bad day for this location. The service was awful. When we finally got a waitress she seemed annoyed that we complained about waiting, and she was a little snarky too. She took our orders without bothering to write anything down. Well, my order was wrong so I had to wait to get my tater tots, which were clearly sitting around since they were soggy and lukewarm. It took forever to get the bill. Everything was going wrong. My food overall was okay at best. I think my daughter thought hers was good. Fortunately, the manager was excellent at damage control, and genuinely nice about our bad experience, and gave us our meals on the house. It's for that reason alone that I'd try this place one more time.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken with mac n cheese
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. My BLTA sandwich without the avocado

gTHHiurF-A69gAxr1w-0Qg.text: One word...... delicious!!!! I literally went back to this place for the Brussel sprouts! They are absolutely amazing and taste just a great the next day. I could go on and on about those things. In addition to the Brussel sprouts I also tried the fried zucchini, fried green tomatoes, buffalo cauliflower, and the Salmon BLT. I promise I didn't have all of that myself. I shared lol. Needless to say, everything was amazing! Everything was seasoned and fried to perfection. The salmon was grilled perfectly. The food came out relatively fast and the waiter was extremely personable. The one downside was it was very noisy inside and the music was loud, which made having conversations difficult. We did go on a Friday night so it may be quieter on a week day. My first visit I sat outside and noise wasn't an issue.   Overall, if you don't try this place and love it, I'll question your taste buds lol

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon BLT with Brussel sprouts

M5L-bEYg8TE9-AUScVSKMA.text: Nice atmosphere.  I had the shrimp n grits and it was a little salty but all of the food looked good. Average but would definitely come back and try something else. Saturday is an abbreviated brunch menu. Sunday's are full brunch options. That may be the better day to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

i8q6rZKZV_DDbn6LiTbpoQ.text: I think they still have a few more kinks to work out here, but I had a great time in this new location of Leroy Fox! The Lady and I used to live relatively near the cotswold(ish) location and I've missed it since we moved outside of uptown, but I'm SO glad that we get it back!  So first off, the patio and the lights are irresistible especially from the street. It's gorgeous. Seated quickly without reservation on a Friday night, which is allllways nice. We started out with a drink - got a Cucumber Basil Lemonade which was very nice. For dinner, I ordered the honey buffalo chicken sandwich, grilled, with a side of brussel sprouts. The Lady ordered a side of the sweet potato tots for both of us to demolish. I can't comment on what she got, because it disappeared too quickly. My sandwich was awesome - though not a ton of heat (which was okay for the mood I was in), but all flavors worked very well. The tots, as stated, were obliterated. Didn't even touch the sauce that came with them.   The reason that I knocked off the one star is kind of two fold. The food, while awesome especially for a casual dinner, wasn't... I don't know, deserving of five stars? It wasn't as good as it gets. And the second point was that The Lady and I ordered a second drink, The Alexa, and it is just *not* good. We were told that it was made incorrectly, and it was taken off the bill and replaced with another Cucumber Basil Lemonade, but I'm surprised that either a) the person who mixed it messed up that badly and hadn't been trained or b) they have it on the menu at all. Just a bad combination of flavors, even our waitress agreed with us haha.  But please - don't take those as True negatives. There is so, so much good here, and it'll keep us coming back to try more off the menu!!  Oh yea, and as Nikki pointed out so elegantly, they have the good ice with all drinks. Twenty points for Leroy Fox!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Buffalo chicken sandwich (grilled, you can get this cooked other ways though!) With side of brussels. Delicious.

-nIpyvPRv8V_s-uzM3sAvQ.text: Good food at reasonable prices with prompt service. Stopped in here on a Sunday night and had no issues whatsoever. I had the honey buffalo chicken sandwich (perfect spice level, IMO) and my S/O had the chicken fried chicken. Overall a good experience with no downsides.

GqdPFpeBWqVno-rj0XdY4g.text: I have to say I was extremely disappointed on my visit, but I have to lead with the fact that I came in just before kitchen closing on a Wednesday. I came to the bar and was told I had 5 minutes to order food before they shut down so I rushed through the menu. I got in an order of their famous 1/4 chicken with a side of greens. In closing mode, I wasn't expecting service to be great and maybe that also impacted the food. The chicken was just plain awful and not cooked evenly. There wasn't any flavor to either the breading or the chicken itself to the point I just left it there. The zucchini spears were ok, but mostly because of the zucchini. The place overall looks cool and would be great to watch sports or events in, but I just had a bad experience that wouldn't take me back. Maybe for a drink because their bar did seem to be fairly decent, but definitely not for food.

SMaR824UZBuwzry8s9rD0A.text: Call me selfish, but I'm pretty pumped that Leroy Fox finally opened up a location closer to my house. GIVE ME ALL YOUR PRETZEL BITES AND QUESO!  I usually get their buffalo chicken salad because I'm obsessed with their buffalo vinaigrette. Today I had to switch it up (very slightly) and go with the  Honey Buffalo grilled chicken sandwich. I absolutely love the fact that they use pickled green tomatoes on their chicken sammies. My friend got the green bean casserole (a warning: it has a layer of cheese) and I went with the brussel sprouts. I could easily just go there and eat a giant bowl of brussels. I never get the fried chicken here (I just always want other things), but my buddy really enjoyed his 1/4 South. Oh, and did I mention- THEY HAVE THE GOOD ICE!  This is a gorgeous spot, both inside and out. I like the outside wall that is covered in Charlotte street names. TVs both in the restaurant and on the patio.   Make parking easy on the street and download the Parkmobile app.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Patio
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken

S29NXsA1KLVI4bzQZKgvxQ.text: I am a big Leroy Fox fan and was excited to check out the South End location. I came here after yoga with a friend for a late weeknight dinner. The place was packed despite it being around 9 pm on a weeknight. We sat at the bar. The space is huge with tall ceilings. Bartenders were slammed or understaffed, but it took awhile for us to get service at many times throughout the night, even as the crowd dwindled. Food was on point. I always choose chicken when at Leroy Fox. We both got the Favorite chicken sandwich with brussel sprouts. So good! It is a great place for a meal and definitely try the fried chicken.

9o46MVkbDkJT2OF13pvCNA.text: I had been biding my time to check out the new guy on the block near my place in Southend.  Pleasantly surprised to see they were trying out a new brunch menu the same day I decided to go!  They really did this place justice with a very very nice outdoor patio space, and a gorgeously decorated inside space.  The woody colors and booths really make the place feel comfortable but at the same time can be on the cover of a magazine.  A great space overall with tables and a large bar area in the back.  There's not a really well defined hostess station, but all the servers and staff are super friendly and really make up for the lack of a stand to greet you when you come in.    Our server Matt was super nice and calm.  With the rush of the football crowd and a Panthers away game, the place got packed shortly after we arrived.  Luckily we got a good "godfather booth" where you can pretty much see everyone in the restaurant and our backs to the corner.    I tried the chicken and waffles.  Their Leroy Fox signature chicken atop a waffle with peach compote and maple syrup.  Perfectly poached egg on top.  It was amazing.  After food was done, we just sat in our booth and got nice a ready to watch a somewhat mediocre Panthers game.  Ugly win, but a W is a W.  Overall a great experience.  It does tend to be a little on the loud side (could just be me getting old) but I saw some early brunches with little ones.  The restaurant does have high chairs so it can be kid friendly... maybe just not on Sundays during football season.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blueberry Smash
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken biscuit
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles

lb183IMVEsEHkyb-pQEI1Q.text: Wow so did you run out of fried chicken patties and have to run to jack in the box real quick to borrow some? But not the spicy patties, the super bland ones that were produced in mass quantity somewhere that mediocrity is the norms. I'm sorry, such a cool big space, great drink menu, lovely server, but mediocre chicken in a restaurant that primarily concentrated on chicken. Leroy Fox is a restaurant that with concentrates on making mediocre chicken or serving chicken they purchased from a fast food restaurant( not Popeyes since theirs is far superior). Ordered the zucchini for an appetizer, delish! Unfortunately the food following that didn't extend the trend. My boyfriend and I each ordered different chicken sandwiches, bad choice. It tasted like nasty fast food reheated crap chicken. Other than the large number of TVs on game days and decent drink menu, why?!?!? A few good $12 drinks don't make up for the food I tossed in the parking garage dumpster before heading up to the apartment tonight. Chose any other restaurant on the block.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun fries yum, chicken sandwich...sure from a drive through window
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Berry mule
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zucchini fried, yum

VYs8yqGzvKp_r5RLh19w9A.text: Like many other Charlotte establishments, Leroy Fox has a nice patio seating area. Not only is it covered, but there's a tv for watching sports game. However food and drinks were only okay. We all had some variation of a mule (they have quite a few options) but I found mine just mediocre and a bit too sweet. We also split an order of wings which were not quite crisp. While the sauce was tasty (how could a combination of buffalo and barbecue not he could?) the less than crisp skin was a bit off putting. Maybe we just got the wrong thing - the fried chicken which another table ordered looked delicious - but given the drinks I don't think I would be back unless someone really wanted to come here.

m5G58TqczIu17DZdoPMpKg.text: Visited here yesterday with a friend not realizing it was St. Patrick's day. With that being said  the outside patio here was live or like the young folks like to say lit !!! Perfect location in south end of Charlotte. I ordered a blueberry smash for my drink ,which was rather tasty,and the pimento cheese fried chicken sandwich. The fried zucchini fries we ordered was perfect for stimulating our appetites leading up to our actual meal. No complaints here just wish the zucchini fries were more seasoned.My friend found herself adding salt to them. Other than that i highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

PBZMRysOvNofAltG4SvS-A.text: The food is good, not great. Big bar and lively crowd is likely the reason to go here.  I had the fried chicken sandwich was was good, just not so memorable that you want to rush back and have another. Mac and cheese was good, but way short of incredible.

AIxE4neiBKIkUxIoRSxpxg.text: Finally got around to checking out the location for a weeknight dinner and left wondering what took me so long. The menu was simple and elegant with some classic options to warm the soul. Went with the grilled chicken, mashed potatoes (home made gravy was amazing) and bRussel sprouts (also cooked to perfection). Kudos to the entire staff for the great experience from the hostess to the check.

XgwYbPE5FVoWOD2pygORHA.text: Wonderful experience! My husband and I ate here this last weekend and it was awesome. The food was great, the drinks were delicious and the atmosphere is comfortable but modern and upscale! They have booths that surround the bar area that allow access to multiple TVs if you are looking to watch the games or just relax for a bit. Nice mix of modern dining with a great southern menu - highly recommend this spot!

OkJT9pGF_z6QOnnAfuZ-Vw.text: Great place to go to with a large group to grab drinks and food. I recommend sitting outside on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento and Egg

ZQCGA5VQupToh0zChxaUag.text: Wow! The food here is on point. First time going & my husband & I were impressed. I Ordered wings with the green bean casserole & it was delicious. My husband ordered the southern chicken sandwich & he was blabbing about it the next morning. The place is in a great location, but difficult to find their name on the building. Lucikly their opened patio helped out a lot. I loved how opened the resturant was & the fact that they had 90's music videos playing on a TV was a conversation in itself. Cant wait to go back & try other menu options.  Our server seemed overly busy & we didn't see her too much which was difficult when we needed something,  but she was sweet & took care of us when needed. Definitly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey buffalo wings with green bean casserole!

9t2eY1Y1x0YX37dADnCcHQ.text: Went this past Saturday for the 1st time.. I checked in for 2 got a text for confirmation.. then we noticed that other people were being sat down prior to us. so we went up to the hostess and we asked her what happened and first, she said that we weren't on the list then she realized that.  we were but she put me down for six people so after waiting for at least another 15 minutes we finally were able to sit down.  hostess didn't even bother to apologize.  Waiter was very nice.. food was OK.. nothing that would make me want to go back..

yneR5VuIxWceUe6mAxdwYQ.text: Seriously, SUCH good food. This is usually a go to spot when I have friends visiting from out of town. However, only go here if you have the time. I have yet to eat here (even during non-peak times) where we haven't had to wait over 45 minutes for food. The food is worth the wait, I just wish I didn't ALWAYS have to wait 45+ minutes.

uKYaAgFnLYUrUVkN2Mv-pA.text: Delicious! Try their brussel sprouts and green bean casserole! I sometimes go here just for the sides, but the shrimp wrap is superb as well.

H2WjUf4w3a3eyLfRsBCgDw.text: Wow!!!! I have lived in the SouthEnd for almost 10 years and we've had a shortage of good restaurants. Not anymore. This place is another one of my favorites. Everything is fabulous. I typically eat at the bar and the service is phenomenal. My favorite is the Homestyle fried chicken dinner with their brussels  sprouts. The chicken has a unique flavor with a bit of a kick to it but not real spicy. Oh and the meat is super juicy. It is always packed, even on the weekdays but once you experience the food and it's beautiful decor, you will understand why it stays busy.  Thank you Leroy Fox for gracing the SouthEnd with your perfect restaurant.

hCkx_SuQCiyt29kU8f80Uw.text: Leroy Fox is southern home cooking with a cool modern blend. They have a long list of craft beer and a handful of cool cocktails. They food was all delicious! They have a great list of side items that were all definitely worth a try.

Pd5wLZfGw-wIIoA0D85nig.text: We got the chicken & waffles, crab cake benedict, and the breakfast sundae. All were AMAZING. The reason for the 2 star review was the service.   We were seated after a long wait (which was fine) but no one came around to our table to tell us they were our server. After 15-20 minutes of sitting there and waiting we told a host that no one had come help us yet. Then after another 5 minutes finally a server arrived at our table and was not warm or welcoming at all. We forgot her name but she was a young (asian?) girl with brown hair and blonde ends. She took our orders but forgot to bring us a round of water after we had requested it. We then had to ask her again for waters which she then brought out after our food had arrived. When our food arrived we asked for a small side of butter but she had also forgot that so then we had to ask a food runner to bring it out. When she brought our checks out later on, it took about another 10-15 minutes for her to pick them back up. I understand they were busy during brunch on Sunday but our 2 hour meal could have easily been under an hour if our server was more attentive. And to top it off she was not friendly at all and barely said anything to us... this experience could have been great but unfortunately that server was not well trained at all and ruined things for us.

EpxaxCEg0ZcfrsQfSa0JoA.text: The food is mediocre at best.  Service is subpar.  If some of the waiters would stop socializing and actually do their job, I would spend less time going inside to get my own straw, ask for refills and or even utensils.

sMRVZiR48ZXjBjDAm9O4JA.text: THE NACHOS ARE AMAZING. Eat here. You wrong regret it. Such a cute spot for lunch or even a great place to chill by the bar and order a drink. The Salmon sandwich with the bacon was also

sxjpqzoQP2sMYdzneAAENw.text: do. i. have. to. review. this.  Because, like Nikki, call me selfish, this is my Friday night date-spot, and we like to sit in the same chairs at the bar and now that everyone is finding out about it, I find us sitting a few away from our "normal seats."  The cocktails are always strong and delicious, and they have a decent wine list BTG.   I modify the salad to be gluten free and usually choose salmon.  My boyfriend loves the burger.  The wings are excellent, too and not breaded.  There are a few kinks behind the bar that need to be worked out with timing. I'd like to see one person dedicated to the well until like 9ish because they tend to get a bit slammed and service goes down. But all in all I think it will get worked out and the atmosphere/walking distance is enough to earn our consistent patronage--and 5 stars.  Cheers, y'all.

kW-2FOOUDACkezZq31akBA.text: We came to Leroy Fox for dinner - "part 2" of girls night out. We heard about the awesome fried chicken and were also impressed by the dessert options.   Our server was great. There were 4 of us, so we ordered 2 of the winner winner chicken dinners with brussel sprouts and Mac n Cheese. Let me tell you how delicious and hot and juicy that chicken was...yum!! But unfortunately that's where it ended. The brussel sprouts with bacon were under seasoned and undercooked -they were still crunchy. The Mac and cheese came out luke warm and had barely any flavor, it tasted like mostly cream and maybe some American cheese.  We sent the Mac and cheese back to be heated and they prepared 2 new orders of it; so it was nice that it was hot, but still no flavor. Not sure who was cooking the sides, but it was a "miss" for them on both. Feels like we paid $35 for chicken because the sides we're honestly inedible.    We ended with dessert. We ordered 2 chocolate chip cookies and 2 bread puddings. They were both decent. I will say that the chocolate chip cookies were disproportionate in size. One had a VERY small cookie compared to the other, but we decided not to complain because we needed to get on to part 3 of our night out. I was able to enjoy my bread pudding, but my friend was brought a banana pudding instead. Our server realized the error and went to the kitchen to correct it. A few minutes later, one of the waitstaff brought her another banana pudding... At this point we were done and she had nothing. Well our server arrives with the bread pudding, but now the 3 of us were all done and ready to go, so we juat asked that it be taken off the check. She left disappointed, and to be honest we all did.  Not the greatest first impression "Leroy".

8AEaMXBzIouAP6z3jcPpIA.text: They still have a lot of new restaurant kinks to work out, but they are handling them well. I went with a larger group last week and after our apps came out we were told it would be 30 minutes before we could order so the kitchen could catch up. I really appreciate that honestly instead of having our order taken and sitting there for an hour with no explanation. They weren't super busy, but didn't seem to have a lot of staff on.   Alex was our server and she was amazing!! She kept her cool even with being busy and dealing with a large table. The hostess was also doing a phenomenal job, although I did not catch her name.   When we finally got our food, it was so worth the wait. Everything I tried was delicious. I got the buffalo chicken sandwich as a wrap and loved the addition of fried green tomato. The brussel sprouts are addictingly good. I tried my boyfriends 1/4 chicken and it was perfect and tender. The mashed potatoes were out of this world. I couldn't stop stealing from my boyfriend's plate.   Atmosphere is great, love the decor and overall vibe in there. The patio is really nice as well.  The only thing I wasn't super impressed with was the cocktails, but I am sure they will perfect.   I cannot wait to go back!

dY6PQt7mO7Vd8Xn2KmV2Ig.text: Food was very good (especially the sweet potato tots) but BEWARE when ordering a drink not off of the cocktail menu.  I am not a huge fan of cocktails so I ordered a margarita. Signature cocktails were $12 so I figured a margarita would be less, because that is the case at every other place I've been in Charlotte if you order a basic drink that is not on the menu. Shame on me for not asking. Three margaritas and $50 later, I was pissed. Yes, these MARGARITAS WERE $17 EACH. Up until this point I had a great dinner and was excited to come back, now I don't think I ever will because this left a horrible taste in my mouth--literally and figuratively.  The consistency of the the drinks was almost as horrendous as the price. My first margarita came in a normal glass (like their water glasses) and tasted strong, but very good. The next two can in a martini type glass and honestly tasted like I was drinking straight tequila. I had to pour ice from my water into the drink to make it bearable. Don't get me wrong, I'd rather it be strong and grimace through it than drink straight mix, but there is a happy medium.  I could deal with inconsistency and poor tasting drinks if the price was right. But this is not Michelin-starred restaurant. We are not in NYC so it doesn't need NYC prices. NO BASIC MARGARITA SHOULD EVER COST $17.

G6VJbsH1FqmCqokx2EGSKQ.text: Such good comfort food!! I had the braised chicken with sweet potato tots and mashed potatoes. Chicken and sides all had great flavor! Also had a great drink selection with several cocktails to choose from. Gorgeous indoor and outdoor space. Great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

Wa3F2prVsG97rhv9vP5K6g.text: You would notice the restaurant is a lot larger than it looks. Covering two blocks the restaurant gets more spacious as you go deeper inside. You would notice the rustic Victorian style chandelier and a mixed seating with sofas that look so laid back and informal that makes you feels like you are in someone's home. I love that they had a variety of seating options, the regular tables, high chairs toward the windows, sofas on one corner, high chair tables and bar stools and even booths! Believe me there is room for everybody! The waitress are awesome and extremely helpful! The menu is short and all southern! The fox Den Wings as starters were awesome - but as others have felt, they are a little smaller than your regular BWW. The Leroy's Favorite crispy chicken sandwich was alright but wished could have been more appetizing as it almost looked like your ChickFilA chicken. Thanked myself for not getting the grilled option which would have been even more bland! The sides are a die for! Choose any side and you won't regret ordering it - satisfies you with both quantity and taste! The prices are nominal and not to pricey. A definite pick for good ambience, great service and good food! Oh, wait, did I tell that there is live music too! Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Green Bean Casserole
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 South Fried Chicken
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and Cheese

oPJSixuJVn1H7ih23OhKIw.text: Absolutely love this place. The breakfast sundae with a Champagne Mojito is the best way to start your day. The staff is always super friendly and the atmosphere is great. Not to mention the great food. I usually don't enjoy restaurants like this because it seems like the focus is on the aesthetic and not the food, but they've nailed it all at Leroy Fox. This is my go to place when I have out of town visitors or family in town. Oh, and they brought my dog his own personal water bowl and gave him treats. They made all of us feel so welcome...just like they always do!

5kTDBK9zEioyP8G-B7Cg-Q.text: Love coming to Leroy's! It's a fun atmosphere and I've always loved my dishes. The zucchini fries are a must every time we visit, and my current favorite is the chicken fried chicken. Staff is always friendly and happy to recommend their favorite dishes.

TySikmX9Y5Hwv6aezuSw8w.text: I had a pretty great experience. The waiter was super friendly and he even paid my dad attention and gave her water.   The food was excellent. We have the Buffalo chicken sandwich and I had the side of makes potatoes. Those potatoes were to die for.

IdFDc0wokDBXaQZdnbXyRg.text: The atmosphere and decor are stellar!  Ordered the Salmon salad. The portion of salmon was more than I expected compared to the salad portion. A+  The dressing pairs very well with the salmon, nuts and greens.  I ordered a hot tea but they only had Chai available. - They supply Tazo tea.  For the ladies, the bathroom is stocked with feminine hygiene products.

lmyfoKpx1kM123eTKfKMHw.text: The chicken fried chicken is to die for! I can't get enough of it. The gravy they put on top goes so well with the chicken. I like to get mine with the mashed potatoes, and green bean casserole. They have really great other sides, like the Mac n cheese!! Yum.  I really love their outside patio area. It's just really relaxing and they have a few TVs out there for when games are on. It is dog friendly, and they always offer water to dogs, which we always bring our dog.  The music can be pretty overwhelming in terms of how loud it is, but it fits their vibe.  Service can be hit or miss, but they are just always SO busy. So I almost expect to be left alone for a little longer then I like, but they are worth it! It's by far one of my favorite places to eat when I'm in southend. you won't be disappointed!

3O60mTmToTYx7CCHh0YrZg.text: I am a BIG fan of Leroy Fox. It's a great place to bring a crowd or entertain out of town guests with unique and delicious food. They have a brunch menu (love the breakfast tacos), lunch, and dinner. The fried chicken sandwiches can't be missed, but their salads are fresh and huge. I like to go 1/2 and 1/2 with whoever I'm with.  Then I highly recommend you splurge for the sweet potato tots as your side.   I also highly recommend you stay away from the Brussels Sprouts side. These are just very fried and greasy pieces of crispy sprouts. Not something to choose if you wanted a healthy vegetable option; opt for the broccoli instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sadie omelet was yummy. Biscuits were cold and not as flaky as I hoped. Broccoli was perfectly seasoned, I only wish it&#39;d come with more!
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake Benedict with those yummy sweet potato tots

mCTMl2cRDwyz6PjpbwfJiA.text: I ordered my food to go.Best thing about this place was the service and the atmosphere! Food was mediocre. The Po'Boy should just be called a shrimp sandwich. The macaroni and cheese was okay. The cheese was not even melted. Would not come back just for the food

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

Sf6auRUKn6TCTKDT9sR7Rw.text: I travel allot so I typically do a bit of research before I visit an establishment. I happen to be in Charlotte for an annual international conference.   So here's the spill.   Ambiance: very trendy, inviting, millennial spots.   Food: I ordered food to go so I didn't eat at the establishment. I ordered the signature fried chicken and brussel sprouts. The chicken was okay,but the brussel sprouts were exceptional.   Service: I ended up walking around the bar a couple times to find a spot to order a drink.  I ended up standing on the side of the wait station next to a gentleman.  All of a sudden one of the bartender(I believe his nickname  was Speed or something)scolds me and says You can't stand there you need to move now.  His delivery was so horrible and rude. It was so loud and rude that the gentleman(whom I later found out was a regular) said hold on,  I'll move down.  I told the gentleman that's ok you and that I couldn't be believe how rude the bartender was and that it wasn't what you say but how you say it.  The bartender proceeds to still try and be confrontational and says well how do you want me to say it. And I tell him I was not talking to you.  He then makes a drink that required smoke and purposely makes an excessive amount of smoke blow directly in my face and in my hair.  The gentleman at the bar says he's really trying to smoke you out now. My throat has been hurting every since.  Now the good.  Quan and Gautreaux are exceptional.  My drinks were made timely and were did the job.  They were very engaged and made me feel better about the better experience. I would definitely give it another chance when I come back.

G1Uil6f7l1Xp8R3FelLrDw.text: LOVED! LOVED! LOVED! the food was amazing and the service was great (Thanks Connor). I was even offered a drink on the house because it was my birthday! Great experience & i'd definitely would returns

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 South with a side of hash brown casserole

auQoDrzIW9P5wKJfwj1NVA.text: Been here twice. First time had GREAT service on a Sunday during football. We sat at the bar. Second time, we did the same thing and sat at bar during football game and the service was pretty bad. I like the food, I like the atmosphere and we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

wlNrlUoH4dcQNXyer6H1sw.text: Let me tell YALL about my new favorite place. First and foremost the food was to die for. I had the 1/4 chicken and Mac and cheese. The batter they use to fry the chicken in like WOW BABY!! So good ... and the Mac and cheese has white cheddar in it which like hello it doesn't get any better than white cheddar. It came with a jalapeno cornbread which was awesome. I got the pear necessities drink and it was good. My boyfriend got the honey buffalo sandwich and it was gone in like a second. The Cajun fries are so good too. Now, on to the other points I need to make. The interior is so cute. They have a full bar. They have outdoor seating which is better than indoor. The waiters are all attractive. Can I get an amen sister!! Anywayyyyy, I will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

i9VsNdOLvbIfWHy0LbqNNA.text: Our  large family visited right after my sons high school graduation. The staff was awesome. The food was superb and the drinks were even better. We were able to celebrate this occasion hassle free. Definitely plan to visit again.

-czI_hjQecQBy203TaqE-w.text: I was super impressed by entire visit to LF. It was a late weekday evening so we were seated quickly. I was not sure what I wanted between the Pimento Chicken sandwich or the Salmon BLT. I went with the chicken with a side of fries and was highly impressed. It was close to kitchen closing but the food came out fresh. The restaurant is very modern on the inside, very intimate and quaint with lots of space at a wrap around bar. My service was excellent. I will be returning! Another perk is the street parking in front of the building. Go check out this awesome spot.

h0sOrs2BIcT6hql_teeerw.text: Amazing food and chicken and really great atmosphere. If you're in the area please try it you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

Uk6yu8-HikOR6dWn7q9GMg.text: Yuuuuuum!!! All the ladies in my book club loved their food! And I certainly loved mine.   Shout out to the chef who kicked his sweet potato tots up a notch and added some cinnamon and maybe a little sugar? Sweet potato tots are typically meh to me, but these joints were GOOD! My vegan brother couldn't stop munching on them from my plate. I almost popped his hand.   My shrimp Po boy sandwich was also extremely good. The shrimp was fried perfectly with great flavor. Just the right amount of sauce, fresh lettuce and tomato.   Definitely coming back to this joint. I was told about their fried chicken and I'll have to try that another day. Maybe the next restaurant outing I'll go there instead of my usual Futo Buta.   Not a fan of the "private" room. It's an area with no door right near the bathrooms. Aside from the onlookers, Someone popped their head in offering a slurry comment about a party while we were in the midst of discussing the book we read. Yea, next time I need a private room, I'll try a different spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Boy Sandwich and Sweet Potato Tots

u3FBDzPZe5PG4YJwDjAPeQ.text: So, this one of my family's go to places. . . I mean we go here weekly for weeks at a time. I love their fried chicken and I am a fried chicken aficionado. Though, I generally prefer my fried chicken cooked by some grandma, they have some good chicken. Besides the chicken, we like the mashed potatoes and gravy, the cheesy grits, the hashbowns (only available for brunch), brussel sprouts, and salads. We also love the buffalo wings. I have a list of my favorite wings in Charlotte and theirs is on that list. My wife also really enjoys their shrimp wrap. It's her favorite shrimp wrap.  I am also a fan of their shrimp and grits. As you can see, we have sampled a variety of the menu and haven't had anything we don't like. Now we don't like to use the paper straws, but I guess I'll let it go because everyone is doing it and it's for the environment.  We also like their cocktails and drinks. They have red oak (a local NC beer) which is a win.  Honestly you can't go wrong. Now busy times can be very busy, so planning may be required. Football season tends to be difficult because it gets packed, but its atmosphere is cool; so it's understandable why folk choose this for their sports spot. You can take your date on a nice date, enjoy a whiskey drink and still throw down with some shrimp and grits. Country and classy.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp wrap (made buffalo style) and loaded grits

2uEKbgu5plukQ-b4CP80dA.text: I've been here for brunch on a weekend, lunch during the work week, and dinner and drinks with friends. The food is pretty good (especially the brunch) but the service really leaves something to be desired.   It always feels like they are understaffed and the waitstaff is always frazzled. Expect to wait a while for drinks, and to make the same request multiple times.   Ultimately, I continue to come here because I like the brunch ($5 Bloody marys and $4 mimosas) and this place is walkable from my house.

pQVAvYZuM7X59aV4j6BRuw.text: This is a comfortable atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating. Our party of 5 took about 40 minutes to be seated, which was to be expected for Sunday brunch. They do not accept reservations on weekends. Our table was roomy and waiter was fast to get our drink orders. It did take awhile for us to get our food (45 minutes). After 30 minutes of waiting, the waiter said that they no longer had hash brown casserole. My friend was really looking forward to it and it seemed odd to tell us so late in the process. One of my friend's plates had less than half of the fry portion that I was given. They did immediately bring more fries when he brought it to the waiter's attention. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich with pimento cheese and an egg. It was tasty, but kind of disappointed when my egg yolk was cooked all the way through. This was a good place to eat, but a few minor flaws with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

r0DxqK3n82KXxg64t4S_Qg.text: South End is filled with gems and this is one!  If you're in the mood for a fun, eclectic atmosphere and good Southern-inspired food, this is your spot. We went during lunch hours and were seated quickly. I imagine that might not be the case for dinner as this is one of the new, hot spots in South End.   For starters, we had zucchini fries. They were more like zucchini wedges. Massive hand cut and hand dipped slices of zucchini battered and fried to perfection were a great way to set the tone for our lunch. This appetizer comes with two sauces for dipping: a tad spicy remoulade and a classic ranch. The basket is great for sharing; hubby and I could not finish all of ours.   For my entree, I selected the shrimp po boy. I had settled on the shrimp Cobb salad until hubby pointed out this dish that's one of my favorites. For my side, I could not resist sweet potato tots. My shrimp po boy arrived with lettuce (that I asked not be included) but I could easily remove it without ruining my dish. The po boy was about six inches and had maybe 6-8 golden brown shrimp; you could choose between fried or grilled. It's Southern and so am I so I went with fried! It was very tasty and the side of remoulade added just the right kick. Those sweet potato tots were excellent. Cute little bite-sized sweet potatoes dipped in a hint of cinnamon were the perfect side for my po boy! Be warned... they give you an extremely generous portion. I had to take half of them home for our sons to try because I couldn't hold them all!  Great food. Awesome atmosphere. Wonderful service.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

tmXP5HP6d4v3A8Q60y6v2g.text: Great place to eat and socialize with friends. The food is great! I've been for brunch and dinner many times. They are willing to cater to larger groups as well. The fried chicken is always fresh!   Definitely recommend this spot.

AVoXT8Sxhd6Xi2Y79rWPRA.text: This place was pretty good.  Slow service (which can be tough at lunch), but the food was great and the staff were fantastic.  A typical sports bar set up with plenty of space to find a table with a view of a screen with pretty much anything you want to watch.  The menu was actually great considering, it is a sports bar, the food is above what you would assume and thats a great thing.  Definitely recommend.

0yFkn7SeiI5UjUDDF_0giA.text: Just ubered  here with friends for late lunch only to be told the kitchen was closed for an hour so they could "catch up.". Must be nice to be so busy you cannot give service all day.. oh, and there were 3 parties in the dining room. Managers all sitting at one table . Message to management: prepare for weekends! That's your bread and butter

fY0iZiAri-YXuHEicqqgrg.text: Our first time here. Drinks were amazing and our server was great. Love the spot, except they have terrible music. If the music was better, I'd give this place a 5 stars.

bStKmfLAOyERfnz0TkdiVQ.text: Love love love the bartenders here! Adam Gautreau made our experience so fabulous. Drinks and apps and even lets us pick some tunes. Love this location of Leroy fox!!

IYMBj0jZ1fOVXWDp9gShoA.text: Our service here was TERRIBLE. When we arrived, my dad ordered a Manhattan. I feel like that is a pretty standard drink to order but the bartender didn't know how to make it and brought us the wrong thing. Once we explained how to make a Manhattan, the drink was good. However, I really feel like we shouldn't have had to walk a professional bartender through making a Manhattan. After we got our drinks, we went 25 minutes without seeing our waiter so we finally flagged down a different waiter to place our order. After finally placing our order, it took TWO HOURS for our food to come out. There was no apology and our waiter didn't even stop by in those two hours to give us an update on our food. The food was delicious, but it didn't make up for our terrible experience. If you look at all my other reviews, they are all 5-stars. I don't ever write bad reviews...but this experience warranted it.

-DmHYAmXgDPaiGx8_PVAxw.text: Terrible service. The waiter asked us if we were ready to order entrees 30-45 minutes after he took our entree orders. It also took our waiter 30 minutes to bring drinks. Sadly this was on a slow night so I can't imagine what other service experiences this restaurant has to offer on a busy night. Our order ended up being wrong.

l-HjNNjhEYn2cCW7emc_DQ.text: Sat at bar as I was by myself.... and waited. Waited a while for attention from bartender. Waited a while for beer to be served. Waited a long time for food order to be placed. Then the food never arrived. Probably the slowest, longest bar dining experience ever.

-Uh_k3fdqRfy6uoMMbeJlQ.text: Rating this a 1 because we had little to no experience here. We walked in on a Saturday night at 9:00 and the hostess informed us that the kitchen was closed. "Unfortunately tonight we're only serving drinks, someone called out and the tickets were really backed up so we just shut the kitchen down." After this short experience (walking in/right back out), and reading some other reviews, It seems as if the back of the house has some kinks to work out. Not sure if we will go back but if we do I'm hoping I can change this rating from a 1 to 5.

6lqW-Vj6M1kNzlWIVGx8AA.text: Friendly staff with great location. I had the chicken pimento egg sandwich. The sweet potato tots were unexpectedly delicious with cinnamon and sugar. Great spot! Hope they start serving brunch soon.

bohRLltq2apOYUq5wmnEag.text: Great place went here for my birthday and everyone here was so nice. I had the zucchini fries they are delicious. I also had the chicken sandwich and the mac and chees which was also great. The owner was very nice also gave me and my friends a round of shots for my birthday I def will be returning here

c3P0xyKrsleZdsIo4EioaQ.text: Had the Salmon on top of mixed greens with a honey chili vinaigrette.  It was delicious.  Tiffany, the bar maid had a great personality

bDt1l_r3LkhV_FjUZYtAjw.text: The food is very fresh and great atmosphere! The drink was also incredible. I got the whole berry toll and it was delicious! Will be coming back!

IL7lAuf_FEapkm50Fl611g.text: Holy deliciousness. This place is amazing - from the atmosphere to the food!! Get as much food as you can, and then take home what you can't eat because it's still so good as leftovers. Only downfall was slow service but it's a brand new place so hopefully that will iron itself out!

aVxfrUp0hIWpLb3aVW5_sg.text: WOW! My husband and I came here for his birthday last week and we were very pleased with the experience. The atmosphere was a very nice open concept with bar seats facing the outdoor patio. We ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich, the fried chicken, mac n cheese, and the sweet potato tots. The food got better with every bite and we cannot wait to go back and enjoy it again! So happy this is right in our back yard.

JF2jkcP1CuMF67Dr5AcEMg.text: This was my first experience at Leroy Fox South End, I will certainly be going back. The restaurant has a great atmosphere perfect place to meet friends or a date night. While I only had drinks there the menu was extensive. The drink I had was the Quinn City Spotlight and if you don't like bitters it's worth getting just for the presentation I thought it was just a little over priced at $12.99 for a drink in a hall ball glass. The others I was with enjoyed their drinks as well. We got there early so the restaurant was not overly crowded and we were all able to enjoy each other's conversation. As the evening progressed it did get pretty loud and we had to yell to hear each other but it was a Friday night. The server was knowledgeable about the menu although a little slow to bring the drinks back to the table. The age range seemed to be about 25-40. The only real complaint that I was they had many TVs in the restaurant and they were all playing the same thing a little variety may be better . All in all I was very impressed with the atmosphere loved the foxes. I suggest you try it if your looking for a relaxed place to meet friends!

Ty07l5sQWnzn9HJF6owHQA.text: We loved it! Such a nice addition to the Southend.  We ate at the bar and sampled a lot.  It was all delicious. Bartenders are very friendly and attentive, the way we like them. Try it out. Doubt you'll be disappointed.

4NBe4WnThKUmJKMbBnIR_g.text: This place is awesome, starting with Mixologist/bar manager Adam Gautreau! Made me one of the best drinks I've ever tasted. To help me avoid the debate of what delicious drink to order, Adam just said "trust me" and went to work. What he came back with blew my mind! It was a berry cocktail with a jalapeno ice cube and it absolutely rocked. While this place has so many amazing cocktails, if Adam is working, be sure to trust him too and he'll craft the perfect cocktail your taste buds are sure to enjoy!

z28NszDwKMym1rrnKv2uZw.text: Great atmosphere and really good service. Appetizers and entrees are simple but good. Will definitely be back here. Bar is amazing plenty of TVs.

dq0tzrZc97R-IH2Z0mHyHg.text: Ok- been to a lot of places in south end. I would recommend Leroy Fox over any other I can think of. We have been here 5 or 6 times varying from late lunch to a late dinner. They have excellent bartenders and management. Definitely stop in if you can. Custom drinks are great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

CDbSTVU65ldaXcXpoy6RMg.text: My new favorite place!! We had a party of ten which included folks from out of town- I was a bit nervous.  Not only did they seat us sooner than expected, the service and food was excellent! The wait staff and manager made sure to check on us frequently throughout our meal. Highly recommend the wings, mac and cheese, and zucchini fries.  Love the friendly vibe and cozy decor.  Parking deck located on the side street is an added bonus.  I will be back very soon!

UjdbFt5y-8GT29JFZTI3gA.text: Laid back atmosphere, awesome decor, and great customer service! The pimento cheese was delicious (we couldn't finish it but they were kind enough to provide a mini container to take home). The Mac 'n' Cheese is to die for. The fried chicken really hits home. Great selection of drinks and beverages. Will definitely return.

lcI3LjChEDzUgUhOHVchbg.text: on a great expedition to decide on a place to din(e), leroy fox was chosen. the shrimp wrap was scrumdiddl(yum)ptious

U4THR331e5jxO3IqCIbiOQ.text: Awesome chicken. Amazing cocktails. Beware that everything is fried, though. I got the Brussel sprouts and sweet potatoes as sides and the Brussel sprouts I weren't expecting to be fried, but they were. Not great for a diet. Service was good though and food was delightful.

zYIISsNCOs-FTo6j6j_Wmw.text: Food is decent to above average, ambiance/ location are great but the service and speed ruin everything else.  First visit was slow with sub par service which I chased up to it still being new.  But After a second trip where a late lunch for two took close to 1.5 hours, not sure if I'll be back anytime soon.

BG_Tdp34P6iDIqd_NkDLqQ.text: South end needed a place like this. Trendy atmosphere and a large bar inside that is great inside for watching sports. The staff were all super friendly and helpful. I ended up ordering the egg&pimento fried chicken sandwich with a side of mac&cheese--both really delicious, really filling, and priced just right. I ended up taking half my sandwich home for lunch the next day. The craft cocktails were a bit pricey ($14) but you can tell there's a lot of detail and care put into making them. I ordered a local beer (which was about $5). They do not serve brunch yet but I'm really hoping the do soon!

rBfhTO_txka3SuFeqaNYJg.text: Me, my sisters and my friend tried this place out last night for the first time. If our server wasn't so good to us and the music wasn't decent I definitely would have given this place one star. So initially I was skeptical about this place because I had read reviews that the customer service wasn't that great. I also heard there might be some issues with the service that african american customers receive, and quite honestly I can see where some of the reviews were correct. So upon arrival the hostess was not friendly and her customer service skills were not the best. It was almost as if she wanted us to turn around, to make her life easier, because the place was so crowded. So after we put our name down we head to the bar to get a drink. The bartender initially was decent when he first took our order. However he then appeared agitated because of where we were standing and asked us to move out of the area we were standing so servers could pick up their drinks. There was literally no where else to stand. It was horrible! The drinks on the other hand were almost perfect. I got the cucumber lemon drink (or something like that). There was also a guy who called himself checking in on us a couple times throughout the night (I'm assuming he was a manager or supervisor of some sort). He behaved so strangely all night and could not take a joke. He was definitely not a people person and made me feel very uncomfortable. Thankfully our server was outstanding! I wish I could remember her name. The food was average. We had zucchini fries for an appetizer which were pretty good and came out piping hot! I ordered salmon, brussel sprouts and grits for my meal. The salmon was also pretty hot and so were the grits. Brussel sprouts were grilled and tasty but lukewarm at best. I did like the mix of music and they played quite a bit of new stuff. Next time I go I'll probably just do drinks and appetizers. I doubt I'll sit at the bar unless the grumpy guy is not behind the counter.

CfWKyRKnVQQa1io4mNaHKw.text: I tried their buffalo chicken sandwich with fried chicken. The food was really good! I would recommend you try the sweet potato tater tot's with any meal. My only complaint is the service was slow and they didn't seem to care much.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

bcHXZ_pFwuSQ3z3vwlSlKw.text: I had door dash deliver the roasted beet salad made as a wrap. It was prepared perfectly and plentiful! The goat cheat and avocado made the flavors pop! I would highly recommend this dish as it exceeded my expectations, especially for a take out veggie wrap!

Ia8DzTMbycqMnCmbpk2aCw.text: I came to Leroy Fox South End when it first opened. There was mass confusion and our food took about an hour. I chalked it up to "grand opening glitches". Since I was in South End, I figured I would try again. BAD decision. We sat right away and then placed our order. We ordered a bottle of wine, pretzel bites and chicken wings. The server poured our wine without allowing a taste first. Our food was dropped off about a half hour later and our server said he would be right back with plates. Well, we never got plates nor did we see our server during our whole meal. Me and my date ate off the serving plate and had to put our chicken bones on the same plate. We were finished with our food and wine. We wanted some more wine, but we didn't see our server to order some more. After another 10 minutes, we asked for our check which was dropped off by the hostess. I am not one to complain, but I asked to speak to the manager. The manager came over and I expressed my disappointment. After he gave me 3 excuses and a half hearted "sorry" he walked away. This place needs a service makeover and lessons on customer service. There are way too many places to eat in the South End to deal with this. PS.. I have often eaten at the other Leroy Fox and have had great experiences every time.

go1ZnDH3vC9PzH-3x47lOw.text: I've only eaten at Leroy Fox once, but have gotten take out several times. Each time was great. Their shrimp and grits are delicious and I love the berry almond chicken salad! I've also had the (pretzels - sooo good) and the buffalo chicken sandwich. I enjoyed them all. Service and atmosphere are great too.

yk_pfRfoYxiuFAJal_pMrg.text: We came from Miami to come to a friends wedding and came across this super cute southern restaurant. The food was amazing! We had fried chicken/green bean casserole & the shrimp and grits with the most amazing bread pudding dessert with a top of ice cream and it was to die for ! The server was very attentive and nice as well.

dGZBQa8KTvdOY5PAF3S5yQ.text: The atmosphere is really fun and the drinks we got were really good. We had issues actually getting our food though. When it came out it was missing sides and then it took forever to get it. We were actually done with the main dish by the time the side came. Additionally we never got the bacon & corn salsa, the honey (the chicken was supposed to be traditional style) or the pickles.

1WaqXp4qBz8dUblusKgx9g.text: Had a great Friday night here! Really good music, great food, awesome atmosphere. Turner was our waiter, he was wonderful! We will be back:)

auCb8d1jqYNnk43cjqlkOg.text: The food is absolutely delicious. We ordered the salmon and chicken fried chicken. We also had the mac n cheese which seems to be heaven sent. I am excited to come back try more things on the menu. The atmosphere is amazing with beautiful decor and a very relaxing vibe. I love how there is a open design concept for the restaurant.

kk5ICw1nLbPSEt574Ju2gA.text: Waited over an hour while tables were available and somehow they allowed a kid to come in and solicit bracelets while people were eating. I couldn't believe what I was seeing.  I'm sure the owner wouldn't be too happy with that. This is the second time we've had a bad experience here. The first time was with take out food. Probably won't go back here.

c6vjIIJ78wfiV6JZ2CY-VQ.text: I always had a good experience here. The atmosphere is always busy and friendly. The staff is nice. I really enjoy their food, especially their salads. I wish they weren't so pricey! They really don't have a lunch menu, which I wish they did. I feel like it would be a great addition to an already great spot. Or maybe the option for half portions at lunchtime!  They have good mimosas on the weekend. The patio area is perfect for a mimosa or bloody mary and people watching.

d01CDTWEEjStHtWMjXjKdA.text: Best gluten free bun I've ever had!!!!! Went for Saturday brunch and the sammie was amazing. Service on the patio was a little slow which was disappointing. But super cute environment.

wA3SHN-CzgIHFlseZWgNUA.text: I enjoy grabbing drinks here with friends but overall I would say this place is good not great. They have decent fried chicken and other southern staples at reasonable prices but overall I've never been blown away by any meal I've had here. Still they have a great looking bar to go with a sleek interior and they definitely get points for playing good music (because who doesn't want to jam out to grunge music while eating Sunday brunch?!). I am not much of a cocktail person but I've been told theirs are fantastic.

dc-ggwgAWw5_M34OjyujhA.text: So this is a perfect place for brunch! The atmosphere is really great. They serve lunch and dinner but I prefer going here for lunch.  They have a omelet station where you can order your own omelette. They also have chicken and waffles and crab cake Benedict. They are know for their fried chicken and you can choose how it's prepared Home style wing style or breakfast style. They have mimosas and I highly recommend the hash brown casserole.

3-I0qL8H563pcQ71dafGDA.text: Looking for a brunch spot near Southend that takes reservations then this is a good pick.    When we arrived we had a party of 5 and it took forever for us to get seated.  It wasn't because they were crowded it was just unorganized.  It took a long time with our service in general.  If it wasn't for the drinks and food being so good I would give a 3 star review.  It took us a little over two hours to get in and out with no wait.  I got the grilled shrimp wrap with a salad and it was incredible.  My friends ordered a kids cheeseburger, chicken wrap, and the breakfast sundae.  Everything was very good.  The food was fresh and had excellent flavor.  I was pleasantly surprised after waiting forever for my drinks.   At the end we had to ask for our checks twice and wait a while for those too.  If it wasn't for the slow service I would be a more frequent visitor.

5lgbAuHNJdmGaCz258K80g.text: The food is much better here than at the other location, so I don't know if they've changed the Cotswold menu, but they should.  The service is better/nicer even though they were in the weeds a bit on our recent visit.   I like the convenient location and look forward to checking it out again.

K8FcbBXd2kPDx9TeIfVTTg.text: Leroy Fox is a staple restaurant for my friends and family. The chicken is amazing! I have tried many things bean burger wrap, shrimp wrap, crab cake, and all of the sides and honestly - while the other options are still great - the chicken takes the cake! (Just prepare to wait 20 min because it is served hot and fresh) My personal favorite side is the Mac and cheese but the sweet potato tots (request extra crispy) and the green bean casserole are also good.
