a_BZ0zUAtAa7c4EmgAGuyA.text: Came here Sunday night after a Panther's game. We were ready for dinner and a drink.   We sat at the bar. It did take a while to get the bartender's attention. It was busy but nothing too crazy. I asked the bartender's opinion on two cocktails and his response was, "I only drink PBR." He then smiled and walked away- didn't offer to find someone who could help me or anything.   I ordered the Young George Washington cocktail (obviously decided on my own). It was basically like a smoked Manhattan. I was pleasantly surprised by this drink. It was boozy and delicious - just like a Manhattan should be.   For food I had the fried chicken sandwich with bacon, egg, and pimento cheese and a side of brussel sprouts. Chicken is what they do and it was very good. I've had better, juicier chicken sandwiches in Charlotte, but this was solid.   I'd come back. Seems like it has a bit of something for everyone.   Service leaves something to be desired, which seems to be a theme as I read these reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento egg chicken sandwich
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Young George Washington

9n4kfLUEQRnwTSU4JmpDNQ.text: So, I came to Leroy Fox with my family after our walk/run on the rail trail. First, for those that haven't experienced the rail trail I highly recommend you doing so. It's safe, you can enjoy great sightseeing and bonus win you get to take food breaks at places like Leroy Fox.   Walking in we were immediately greeted by the host and taken to the first available seats inside. We sat at the half round booth near the bar. Our server came out to greet and welcome us. He shared the specials for the evening and suggested a few of his favorites.  We started with the zucchini straws as an appetizer. We all were expecting them to be skinny, but they were nice large slices and had great breading in them. It was sort of spicy but not overwhelming and the two dipping sauces that they give you are great also.   Shortly after the appetizers came out, our meals were served. Timing was perfect, I like that we did not have to wait much longer for our entrees. Everyone said they loved the food, but the service from our server was outstanding. He was so personal able and remained engaged with us. I hate that I forgot his name {fail on my end and I said his name like a million time... grrr} but he made sure that we were well taken care of. Always checking in, refilling our drinks {that's huge deal for my Dad} and he even shared with my mom that if she didn't like her food option as she was a little uncertain that there was no problem with changing it. Thankfully she loved everything {lol} and we all were pleased with Leroy Fox South End and the service they provided. We most certainly will be back and I've already started raving to friends how they should try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

xnP2FC_c3uSskOMKK-q5gA.text: The food here is really great when they seem to get it right. The fried chicken is always good, great buffalo sauce, appetizers are always really on point. Where the restaurant really starts to falter a little bit is definitely in the terms of how their service is like. I've got a lot of attitude from some servers over the past few times I've been there, and that's come with a lot of wrong orders that come out. And it takes a little bit more time then I'd like to get the right food to come back out, but like I said when it's right it's good, they just need to tighten up a little bit more about their service.

fiFDlXdRjQ2CPMPRLYrrTQ.text: The food presentation and accuracy was not up to par at my last Lunch experience.  The salads were missing ingredients, the shrimp did not taste fresh. The kitchen refused to recognize an error, they didn't plate/sauce the exact same order of wings the same way the meals looked and tasted very different. The wait staff was rushed and not attentive felt like we were chasing them down.  We will not be able to support this location for a group lunch again as it was slow service and poor service recovery.

1-U4t1HwNpsuFrySu0Sfaw.text: Review on only drinks! SO good and beautifully presented.  All the drinks were delicious and not too sweet! The blueberry smash was a favorite (short purple picture). Mine (orange) was a tequila drink that I can't remember the name of, but highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

r4gB67-fgdTcBaJBsGvj0g.text: When this spot opened up , I thought it was going to be a little too fancy for my tastes, but don't let the decor fool you . It is a very casual ambiance, even though the inside is what I would call romantic decor ....anywho, the food.  I order a buffalo chicken salad. Sounds basic, but it was anything but. It was fresh greens and vegetables , perfectly grilled chicken that came with a side of buffalo sauce and a side of buffalo vinaigrette ( very interesting twist on a vinaigrette).   I wasn't impressed by my Georgia Tractor mule ( peach infused mule with real peaches ), but I'm willing to go back and make my way through the specialty cocktail menu possibly for brunch. Yes brunch! And I'd really like to check it out, because the patio is pretty cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

HqSJEmvYLvgt6mmodoByTA.text: TL;DR Review  Pros: - Great high quality, delicious food. Possibly Top 3 for Fried Chicken in Charlotte. The price is worth it.  - Good space and chill vibe. The outside patio is good from happy hour and day drinking on a nice day out. The inside can accommodate large groups. - It's located in South End in walking distance to mass transit, bars and other restaurants. You can even hoof it to Uptown, it's an easy trek.  Cons: - Service is kinda eh. We sat at the bar and service was lacking at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. The National ... 1/2 fried chicken, 2 sides (Mac &amp; Cheese and Brussel Sprouts)

_HCktXhON6ZGHmafYzgMnQ.text: Rodney was our server and he was so great! I really enjoyed my food, my omelet was oversized and the potatoes were delicious.  Mimosas had a good level of OJ in it.

VPtv6mnwu0Kuumxqxwa1Fw.text: Went for dinner. Split the buffalo cauliflower appetizer it was great to share. For main had the grilled shrimp wrap and Mac and cheese. Everything was great except Mac and cheese could of been a little warmer. It was almost room temp.

1C1C5wKdQH8ABNB-HKC1sg.text: Great spot for Brunch and even better you can bring the dogs. Drinks are affordable and aesthetic is nice on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake Benedict and spicy omelette with hashbrown casserole
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hanging out with the pups

J4kxnB-MP5JXhJXZhGwiKg.text: Love coming here with my friends! The food is always amazing and the cocktails are just as great! I've had several dishes from here! My go-to(s) are the buffalo chicken sandwich, the pimento and egg chicken sandwich, braised chicken nachos, zucchini fries, the Brussels sprouts, and Cajun fries! Brunch on Sunday's can be busy so plan ahead if you're party is large! The ambience and environment is very relaxing! During major sporting events they have plenty of TVs to view them on!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baaarrrrr
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

N_ui9xFXULWhqGlxui2euA.text: If a place has wings on the menu, it is usually a great place to start because it tells you a lot.   I am very particular about chicken wings. I get it...they are thought to be a simple menu item; therefore, also assumed as "easy to prepare". So, when I request crispy wings, I expect just that. The wings at Leroy Fox leave me majorly underwhelmed. I assume that this also has something to do with the fact that they showed up about five minutes after I ordered. Now, I'm no chef, but I can guarantee anyone that it takes more than 5 minutes to prepare crispy wings. I believe the wings were parboiled and finished on the grill. ALL the wrongs steps in my concept of a great wing.   The cocktail saved this review. The "For Whom the Berry Tolls" cocktail is amazing. Made with tequila, basil, blackberry and jalapeno, it is a perfect blend of sweet and heat. I noticed that the bartenders take a lot of time and attention with the cocktails. For this reason, I may return...and will update this review per a different experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. For Whom the Berry Tolls
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. For Whom the Berry Tolls with a jalapeño sphere

sXOL-c3b3qDTJJdhYZIWTw.text: I love that they've opened up a Leroy Fox closer to my house, so I've been to this one quite a few times already. The service has improved every time - you can tell they're getting in the swing of things. As always, the food is delicious. I do hate that they've gotten rid of my favorite thing for Sunday brunch - the which came first. But their sandwiches are always wonderful, so are the sides & appetizers. I definitely suggest the zucchini fries or the pretzels if you want an app.

Vcj-dEpGEtiK4EDSy8mwhQ.text: This place is absolutely amazing! The manager Adam is the nicest person I've ever met, their food is so good. I had their fried shrimp and it tasted like a 5 star meal, and their Mac and cheese is to DIE for. But their cocktail menu is what gets me, they have so many amazing cocktails and the new plum one coming to the menu in April and the most delicious alcoholic beverage I've ever had in my life! Leroy Fox is a MUST!

_vLvywyPfcmMwR_xK3UDEg.text: Cool spot with great atmosphere - tried it for the first time two or three months ago and enjoyed it. The food was decent and the service was excellent. I tried the grilled chicken wrap, which was ok. The sweet potato tater tots were too sweet for my taste - on top of the naturally sweet flavor they also dust them with cinnamon. The wings have potential but were just ok IMO - I prefer my wings much more crispy than they serve them (this is even after we requested extra crispy). We'll definitely go back to try other items.

TjW6DSxdi4kkbl_sNCCZdw.text: Love the new location in south end. The food is excellent just like the other location. This location does have a more bar style atmosphere.  Service was slightly off but expected with a new location. I do have one request though. Please remove the shelf over the urinal in the men's bathroom. I hit my head on it. I mentioned it to a waiter and they stated "we have gotten a lot of complaints about that but they won't take it down."  You should listen to your customers.

Zncg_4HXCQoI2l8ZjZCLbw.text: Excellent!!!! Love this place! Great cocktails and great food with a very cool atmosphere!

vxsjCS9bQlVwf3zYxZFSsQ.text: Had the buffalo chicken sandwich with brussels...portion size was super huge and food was outstanding!  Watch your head at the urinal as someone thought it was a good idea to install a full size shelf above which about took me down for the count!

CLMesG5HVSdcwnms4O9UBQ.text: Yes!  I have to say that I was not the biggest fan of the other location but tried this one at a friends urging.  It was very very good and love the atmosphere.  I will be back to try more of the menu.

r0-9xIRMl3xjnCUt44d69g.text: Food was decent but it took 40+ minutes to get two sandwiches out to us. And when the check came, we didn't get anything off our check to make up for the lengthy wait. I thought for sure our round of beers would have been comped. We ended up having to inhale our food because we had somewhere to be.   Not the first time I've experienced slow service there so it will be my last visit for sure.

8nNyeHWTayfIPJEKRt1Zhw.text: I was super excited to try this restaurant, however, service was horrible. Upon arrival I was told it would be a 5 minuet wait to sit outside, as I'm waiting for over 20 minutes another group who came in after me was seated. When I went to ask how much longer the wait would be, the hostess got an attitude with me because she didn't put my name on the wait list. Once we were actually seated, it took the waitress 15 minuets to acknowledge us, and we waited for our food for over an hour. The manager apologized for our wait and covered our check so I appreciated that. Overall, even though the manager tried to rectified the situation, I would not recommend this establishment.

aOwyqBCVrYAFBPco4s8U6g.text: Tried this place out for lunch, and I must say I was very impressed. Service was solid, the decor is really nice and open. The drink menu looks great although I did not partake. The menu is pretty straightforward but I had to try the fried chicken. Being located down the street from the Coop, I thought it was pretty ballsy to open a place specializing in fried chicken but it was REALLY good. Like for real. Also had the brussel sprouts with bacon which were excellent and the grits were solid. Will definitely be back again for drinks.

35k6l-5e7VQo3eSxeTyKbQ.text: The Mac and cheese I had today at Leroy fox makes up for how bad my meal was at eddie v's on Friday! Hands down best Mac and cheese I've ever had

8PvQkxiQ0026H4I0Khv31A.text: We tried this place out on Sunday 1/28 and the menu sounded delicious but the food was only average. We got the fried chicken and the grilled blackened chicken. I will say the fried chicken with the seasoning on the breading was excellent. I would recommend this dish. The pimento cheese and pita appetizers were also excellent. However,  that is when things became average. The grilled blackened chicken was ok but I could have made that at home. The mac and cheese would have been amazing had the chef not dumped a full salt shaker into the cheese sauce. The green bean casserole was not impressive and would not recommend. The corn bread had great flavor but was dry. Overall this is a cool spot but I don't think I would go back for the food. Hanging out with some drinks would be good but would not return for dinner

v_DVWSd14GTBrAETZSebXA.text: We love this place! Great food and drinks, friendly service, and awesome atmosphere. Chicken wrap is sooo good. Crab cakes were delicious too, but tiny.

3qSBdW9eol62lPW2qby9IA.text: I ate at this location with some of my bridesmaids yesterday after they found their dresses at Brideside.  We always ate at the one in Cotswold, but it's a bit out of the way. This one is amazing! It fits in with South End, is very hip and we had wonderful customer service along with amazing food! Will be coming here on a regular basis now that it's 5 minutes down the road. Check it out if you haven't yet!

J6PuiHGuS5KvS1Heu9vDjw.text: Service was nice but all of the food was too spicy for us to eat. Normally love brussel sprouts but everyone at table agreed they were too spicy to eat. What a waste. Nachos were interesting with black eyed peas but also spicy. No reason to come back but band outside is what brought us in. They were great!

BkFVuqE3ErYdaSQc6BApFg.text: We came here on a regular Sunday night, the restaurant was definitely not slammed. We sat outside and waited for OVER an hour. After about an hour and 15 minutes, the manager came out and promised our food would be served soon. We waited another 20 minutes - still no food. The waitresses were not attentive, leaving our water glasses empty. Both times people in our party have been there before, they got sick from the food. Don't waste your time.

1QmFFkgSu-WXrKvz54Py9A.text: We waited 30 mins for our food order to be taken (waitress circled us 3 times during the 30mins), then 45 mins for our food to come out. Everyone around us got served before we did and people that got there after us got there orders taken before us. The waitress gave us no napkins or silverware until we asked for it. So disappointing! The front staff was awful! Had it not been for the chef/cook that came out and said our bill was on the house, this restaurant would have gotten 1 star because I can't give it 0. We were the only spanish/Latin group and the restaurant was not that busy. I'm not pulling the race card but it really makes you wonder. Awful service.

Mt4KM9sF3uVG1FvDGA0PTA.text: Food just as good as the original location and vibe/atmosphere even better!  I am not even a vegetarian and the black bean burger was amazing!   Brussels sprouts are on point!  The owner really wants things done right and is there himself making sure it happens!

zERRhrm9bVcIOtmO2FqK3A.text: We live in south end and finally decided to check this place out.  Wow!!!  Chicken fried chicken was on point.  Get the sweet potato tots and Mac and cheese.  Didn't even have to ask for honey mustard with the tots.  Service was great!

056QI3nXPxBEfoLZOqBVSA.text: This place has phenomenal food, excellent service, and a very nice atmosphere.  Tonight I had the bbob Nachos for an appetizer, the nachos were crisp and covered with fresh toppings. For my entree I had the chicken fried chicken with Mac and cheese along with sweet potato tots.  All the food was brilliant, it was so good I couldn't choose what part was my favorite.  I will definitely be back to explore more of the menu.  Thank you Leroy Fox for such a great experience!!!

4R5boUhgQXIhXlX68YZMAg.text: I think overall, the restaurant is good. Went for Brunch and the wait for average 15 mins so not too bad for a party of 4.  Ordered the 1/4 north but with waffle, eggs, sweet potato tots, and a bloody mary.   The good: Bloody mary was great and came in time. Just the perfect blend and I enjoyed it enough to order a 2nd one. The food came and was good too.  The bad: Not much to say on this category other than the fried chicken was very dry and the sweet potato was just that, sweet potato tots (expected something seasoned) but was not bad just not my expectation.  The ugly: the time it took to get the food for 4. That said, it usually means the foods coming would be excellent but the food was good at best.  4 star because the atmosphere and vibe added to the experience and the waiter was great. Service and vibe is the additional star so will I be back? Definitely...

Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2 sunny side eggs with waffle

sJvoqfU7ltWM0AGqV_BbRQ.text: Fried chicken and buffalo cauliflower are a MUST! We have been here numerous times and have always enjoyed a great time and meal. I recommend getting there by scootering, biking, walking, light rail or anything other than a car as it is a little difficult to park in that area.   The restaurant is really beautiful with inside and outside dining. There are a ton of TVs which makes it an awesome spot to catch your favorite game. This is also definitely a great spot for large parties because there are so many tables that can accommodate it. Staff is super friendly however service can sometimes be spotty and slow.

Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mashed potatoes

IamldKb_qTVnXz5xF4UmEw.text: Presentation is their specialty!  The "Young George Washington" is literally one of the best drinks I've ever had in Charlotte.  It resembles an old fashion and is presented with a smoking glass, a large ice ball, and a sweet and tasty mix.   The zucchini fries were flavorful with a kick of spice but didn't blow me away and the menu is a bit underwhelming.   Pro tip: start your night here with a drink and an app.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Far left is glass of smoke, middle is the ice ball, right is actual drink!

bBBCvnWjT9G9QxgfL5YNmQ.text: Stopped by this location on a Saturday night, decently busy, but not overwhelming. We were seated promptly in the outdoor seating. I ordered the chicken fried chicken with mashed potatoes and mac n cheese. My fiance ordered the braised chicken with the sweet potato tater tots and French fries. Both of our meals were amazing! Our service was also great so you can bet we'll be back next time we're in town. The Mac n Chicken was creamy and smooth. Both chicken dinners were perfectly cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Braised chicken
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Fried Chicken
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

n3VaFPkYrzzebbajqL4i0g.text: I had heard so much about this restaurant and was eager to try it. We arrived today (party of 3) and it seemed like good timing as the restaurant wasn't too crowded.   We were quickly seated and the restaurant is nicely decorated.  Our drink orders were taken and we have several questions about the menu which were sufficiently answered. Here comes the downside. After placing our orders, we waited a total of 35 minutes for our food to arrive. The hostess never came over with an update and when we asked about our food the response we were given is "let me check on it".   The food arrives. My fried chicken was hot but over cooked. The Brussel sprouts with bacon was hard, dry and very salty.  The cornbread was room temperature.  My friend ordered the chicken tenders with Brussel sprouts and her chicken wasn't seasoned at all. Her Brussel sprouts were hard and salty as well.   The hostess came over and asked about our meal and when we told her the Brussels were hard she offered to replace them with Brussels  but we declined. She didn't offer any other sides nor did she seem terribly interested in making us have a good dining experience.  When our checks arrived she did comp us 20% which made it a little better.   Looking at other reviews maybe our experience was just a one time thing. I hope so. I'd like to come back and try it again because the place is really nice but not too keen on the lackadaisical attitude of the wait staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

YUF7jBvrlpuo47TpJg_zbQ.text: I LOVE this place.  The fried chicken sandwhiches are fantastic to split or eat whole and always taste delicious.  When you get the fruit side you don't get filler melon and apples you get fresh seasonal fruits like berries!  The cocktails are also a must, love the For Whom the Berry Tolls or whatever the bartender feels like making!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch chicken biscuit with fruit

-9DT7zJJmpZyQMjCAxKyQQ.text: Came here on a busy Saturday night with friends and were seated quickly. They have a small outdoor patio but we wanted to sit inside because of how hot it was outside.   We ordered the pretzel bites to start. They were warm and soft and came with two dipping sauces-- queso and a mustard sauce. Definitely better than the ones at Brass Tap.   I ordered the 1/4 South plate with mashed potatoes and gravy (on the side). It was pretty good but I think I will order something different next time.   My friend ordered the bread pudding for dessert. It was ginormous compared to the picture! I didn't try it but they said it was really good.   There were lots of families with small children so it seems to be a good family spot. I think later at night it feels more like a bar than a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 South plate
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread pudding is ginormous

l7_JxJzaRn-gcvRVOKyrlw.text: Really good quality food... Haven't had something that I did not like. I'm usually picky about eating chicken and this restaurant had really good chicken, exactly to my liking. Their zucchini bites and pretzel bites are stellar...Highly recommend. Moscow mules are cold and tasty with that good crushed ice - makes a difference! Getting it to-go isn't bad either but definitely smaller quantity the one time I got it. Parking was free up until last week in the deck and now I heard you have to pay such is a deterring factor for me, at least in getting it to-go. That's out of their control though. Maybe get lucky and get a street spot for free after 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious chicken, caramelized onions, boom boom sauce, Swiss cheese with au jus and Cajun fries

zxcrlqHEDjZTiPol6E_BiQ.text: I guess the old adage of anything worth having is worth waiting for is applicable to this spot. My friends and I decided to have dinner at Leroy Fox  Saturday night of All Star weekend 2019. We arrived around 8:30pm and the hostess advised me that the wait was 1 hour and 45 min. She apologized, assuming we would not want to wait. I told her it was fine, they typically over guesstimate the wait time!   We were told that the bar was first come first serve. We made the assumption that the communal  table  was included in bar seating. After speaking with  a few ladies seated at the table, they told us we could just sit, since that is what they did. However, a staff member told us that they are seating parties at the table from the wait list--- we were booted. We eventually found a decent place to wait and not feel that we were in the way! We ended up sitting at a table next to the patio area to wait on our table. Of note- as we were waiting there were multiple empty tables in the restaurant. Not sure  how they seat people, but I did find this to be interesting.   After about an hour and 15 min wait we were finally seated. Our table was behind the bar directly in front of two televisions.  Prime location to check out the All Star dunk contest! I will also add that the seats are very comfy! However, we noted that all of the people seated behind the bar were African American. Coincidence? Possibly, but just something that was observed.   Our server promptly greeted us and took our drink orders. Since we waited so long we needed no time to decide what we were having. I had the berry mule, chicken nachos and sweet potato tots! The food was prepared and delivered promptly. Was it worth the wait-- yes. I loved every bite of the sweet potato tots.  I am going to go ahead and say they are the best I have ever had. The nachos were a flavorful  combo of beans, chicken cheese and just yumminess!   I must also give kudos to our server! He was attentive, but not over the top. He did a great job!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken nachos! -- AMAZING!
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon grits and Mac n cheese

dqQuEV1vxN0Lp7hM29PdNg.text: An unexpected place to get good food in South End comes from Leroy Fox! This place was so crowded and I didn't understand why until I ate their food here!   So we came for a Sunday brunch but had the regular menu with their drink special for Sunday. The place has a nice atmosphere and televisions everywhere to watch the event of the day which happen to be the NFC championship.   We ordered the chicken with sausage gravy with a Mac and cheese side and the pimento cheese and egg chicken sandwich with the Brussels sprouts. Man the Brussels spouts were so good and light I could have literally have them for my entire meal! The chicken was so moist and delicious that I wasn't expecting it to taste as good as it did when I bite into it.   That is why I was easily surprise and felt like it was great service combined with good food. Everything came out in a timely manner even with the place being at full capacity!   Definitely coming back again and highly recommend it to anyone wanting a good place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

5EaW6or5OEtFh8q4GTGrhw.text: Good food cooked fresh with Fresh ingredients and nice service. Very nice ambiance and great drink selection. I came on a Saturday around 1pm had grilled chicken and sweet tater tots !! Yup you read that right !! Sweet tater tots  . They have a nice outside area that's covered and a projector that you watch during the day. The decor is by far amazing. This is the second location however it is modern and updated. Very local it stops right at the light rail. Street Parking was reasonable to locate. The bar seating is nice cushion seats not your average bar stools. They offer a brunch menu and the pricing overall is decently priced. I would come back if I'm every in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese  with a side of blueberry SMASH

eKSPqGJGrWP1XXMvZxAfbw.text: I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good southern meal. I have been here for brunch, lunch, and dinner and it never disappoints.   For lunch/dinner I usually get the honey glazed chicken and two sides of Mac and cheese. The honey glazed chicken is amazing and great option for those who don't want to eat something fried. In addition, I personally cannot do the fried food due to allergies but my friends talk about how the fried chicken, tots, and fries are really amazing! The Mac and cheese is definitely one of the best items on the menu, and it's only a side. I get it every time I come and when I took my mom here, she said it was the best Mac and cheese she ever had.   For brunch, I either go with eggs benedict (without the crab because I'm allergic) or French toast with a side of hash browns. The French toast here is great! It has a cannoli filling that is unlike other places I personally have been, and while that can be a bit too sweet, I usually only ask for it on one side. Plus the mimosas are only $4 and properly made with mostly champagne with a dash of orange juice.   One thing to note, this place has little to no cell service inside. Helpful to keep you off the phone when you're out with friends but hard to text people you are meeting up with.

g_Lx8-fxQ0bieYKLE-fnGg.text: Highly recommend this place!! I came on a whim with friends. We knew we wanted to get drinks for sure. My roomie ordered Brussels sprouts & wings.  The sprouts were really crispy but tasty. The wings were SO good. Crispy, bold & flavorful. I opted for the honey buffalo chicken sandwich & fries. I so wish I had taken a picture of it. It was so freaking good. I wolfed it down like no one's business.   The ambiance is really nice. Food arrived quickly, service was bomb, and the drinks were smacking. I was so happy to have tried this place. I can't wait to go back again to try more drinks!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

0zUQcWRE6K7G7hRL_YDm7Q.text: Great food. Great location and atmosphere. Our waiter was on point and was on top of everything. Would recommend the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and Cajun fries

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo chicken sandwich. So good

g77c0HJxCDsLqw-iY37IrQ.text: Alright, the service here is pretty good so far.  Been here twice, sat at the bar both times.  Different bartenders, but both very friendly and attentive.they usually have some kind of drink special, today is half price wine. That's awesome. I'll take the draft !!!!

qEsW4ZlK6AruA5oni3KiNg.text: I love it here! I came here for the first time with some friends yesterday. I have heard great things but never gave it a try. I had their lunch food which was the honey buffalo chicken sandwich with sweet potato tots. The tots were delicious and the chicken was great! I wish there was a little more buffalo on it but it was still amazing none the less.   There was a large crowd there for the football games but we were able to sit at the bar. For being extremely crowded the food did not take that long. On Sunday's they have mimosa and bloody marry drink specials. Both of the drinks were amazing and strong! They have many TV's throughout the entire restaurant so you can watch games anywhere you are sitting. I cannot wait to go back and try their brunch food and their fried chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

Zpbv-Q7jLHFP0TYvQpAw3A.text: Saw the reviews in Yelp. Interesting to come from Texas to get Southern food; the original south I was told. Had to try the chicken fried chicken, macaroni and cheese and green bean casserole!  Everything was excellent; the chit was crisp with creamy gravy; the green bean were nice and peppery. My daughter's sweet potato tator tots were delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

PNBBj--kgnvPb56IZkvpXw.text: I've been a fan of the other Leroy Fox for years and the South End location offers the same great service and food. I like to describe the food as elevated comfort food. The best thing Leroy Fox is known for is their chicken and for me the best zucchini fries anywhere.   There's plenty of seating and an outdoor area where you can watch the rail go by. The decor is modern with a mix of seating (booths, chairs, high tops and the bar) and I love the striped linen napkins and floral pattern plates. At lunch, it wasn't super crowded and we were seated right away. They have a great drink menu, but we can't drink on our lunch breaks.   The menu offers appetizers, gourmet salads, many sandwiches and wraps, and meals like chicken tenders, shrimp and grits or chicken and biscuits. And the sides are the home cooked kind you crave at Thanksgiving. I ordered the honey buffalo grilled chicken sandwich with a side of those legendary zucchini fries with the boom boom sauce.It did not disappoint. Bun- brioche, perfect for the size of the sandwich. Chicken- tender, juicy and plenty of that honey buffalo sauce. Topped with sweet pickle and blue cheese - perfection. Now those zucchini fries. Giant spears breaded in chicken batter and fried. Pair that with a spicy sweet creamy boom boom sauce and you have a winning side. I dream about these things.   Glad to have a closer location I can get to from work with really awesome food!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Honey Buffalo grilled chicken sandwich and zucchini fries!

umDq6WdRWoT8roQ7ZcSRiA.text: I had a great time at Leroy Fox. I went there randomly on a Saturday night, they were extremely busy but they made it work well. Our server suggested trying one of their signature drinks, that mirrored an old fashion. It tasted very well and the smoke that they use to display the drink was visually appealing .  I started with the shrimp and grits and my partner had the salmon salad. I will say that the vinaigrette that they use for the salmon salad was delicious. I believe it was a honey cilantro vinaigrette. I'm not sure how they made it but I would love to find out. My shrimp and grits was amazing and good I would highly recommend it.  They did have a bar area so if you're not coming into eat sitting at the bar and drinking as an option as well. I love the little fox pictures around the restaurant and made me think of the movie Mr. fantastic fox

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Decor
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

j9Pi-EbKPR9BEblby8bZvA.text: Best southern food in Charlotte. Get the family winner dinner platter and Mac and cheese and sweet potato tots you will be super satisfied. It is better than haberdish, the chicken skin is very well done and flavored. And it's the best Mac and cheese I've ever had (this is coming from a New Yorker). Super underrated I've been here three times and I'll keep coming back for it

0sHDkKkvs4_9jQIoNKFxKA.text: This is my second time here with different food ordered and it was great! Unfortunately, I had some issues with the wait staff. Upon arrival, Isabella I believe at the entrance did not greet me or my mother and told us we would have to wait 45 for seating not by the door. When I suggested for a booth that just needed to be wiped down she said that would work but also made us wait another 15 minutes to be seated after the table was cleaned. Jennifer cleaned it for us and was very nice and went ahead and got us waters for our wait. She also helped out a lot towards the end of our visit. She's great and so was our waitress April. Overall, I wasn't disappointed.

-lhVR91r3CogwUCFLV5pcg.text: Delicious! Husband says this was the best chicken sandwich that he's had in awhile(bbq chicken sandwich) Mine was amazing- the Pimento Fried egg chicken sandwich. The sweet potato tots were perfectly crispy- definitely on the sweet side. Great server and really pleasant eating outside:)

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

1fo4CuLelnZiAU_ElbIkKg.text: The food and drinks were amazing.   Our service wasn't.  Our server Kaylee was not attentive.

9GFQHAfVIocu_5HMOx0DOg.text: The only reason we come back to this Leroy Fox is Chase. There isn't another bartender that even tries to do their job: consistent texting behind the bar, snappy comments, and updating social media accounts. We ended up standing up and flagging someone down after 10 min without someone checking on us. There were 5 bartenders at one point, and 3 of them were standing around talking with multiple people waiting on drinks. We've been going to the Leroy Fox on Sharon for 2 years now and recently been trying this location out. Very disappointed in the lack of effort by the bartenders (except for Chase) and the Mac n cheese. There is some added spice to the Mac n cheese here that they don't add to the dish on Sharon.  Also, they don't put on the sound for games here unless it's a Panthers game. No one wants to sit at a full bar on a Sunday listening to the top 10 of 2004 when football games are on.

S513BTnoAoikSxzO2H1StQ.text: Discovered this place recently and was pleasantly surprised. Food quality is great  They are known for their fried chicken and the shrimp and grits with fried egg on top. Great experience and highly recommend it. The environment is updated and comfortable and the service was excellent.

wRaQe88vZcX46o_nHUNVAw.text: Went to this location for the second time today. I really enjoy the ambience of the place and the food is usually on point. I was disappointed today that I ordered a tea like usual and when I got my check the waiter charged me for 2. When I asked why he said they are required to put in and charge for refills. REALLY for ice tea!!!! I have eaten there and plenty of other places and never play for refills on ice tea...to pay $4.50 because I got refills makes no SENSE!!! It's not like it's any special tea. Crazy and they lost me with that!

IBseAGU9qbRJTlXm41T23A.text: Cannot get enough of the zucchini fries !!!!! Also they have an amazing green bean casserole!

aVDgks_2y5nULwIS0noskA.text: Best and only zucchini fries I'll eat in Charlotte. It took me a while to come around to zucchini fries because every time I've had them, they've been soggy and greasy. Leroy's zucchini fried are crisp and crunchy, and perfect with ranch (but tastes great even without it)! I order them every time, and they have consistently been delicious.

Oie3srCm8HHGb1Z6PLh7dg.text: Great food and atmosphere.  Zucchini appetizers were good and the honey chicken sandwich was great. We will be back. The dips for the zucchini fries are great. Buffalo blue cheese and ranch. The fried chicken dipped in buffalo honey is the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

OaKlSs14NewExyPrtkaEzw.text: Leroy Fox is HANDS DOWN my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. My husband and I go here all the time - we can't stay away. We have yet to have a bad meal yet. Be warned - they get crowded on the weekends. What to get? The pretzel bites, zucchini fries, sweet caroline dip, pimento and egg (incredible) and nachos are a must.  Bottom line, you'll need to go here multiple times and try different things. It's all amazing!

HxNWQzW23QYNYqasYpt4gQ.text: I had never been here before so I though trying it out for Sunday brunch seemed like a good idea. We were sat quickly at a table by the window (nice open lighting) and looked over them menu. It was hard to choose because there were so many deliousious sounding things to pick from. The service was great and the food was yummy. It was a tad bit noisy, but that's kind of how all the restaurants are in Charlotte now. We left completely satisfied, and I even took a bunch of food home for a second meal. We will be back.

X3DQd_8DGYnabRy1nxyuPA.text: We had time to kill before out flight and my husband was craving Southern cooking.  What a great place!  I started with the very berry mule... their tale on a Moscow mule with fresh mashed berries.  Soo good!  We both had the chicken fried chicken with sides of mac and cheese and green bean casserole.  Portion was HUGE! Perfectly cooked and the mac and cheese was outstanding!  We sat outside and that just made the meal.  Wish I had room for dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

EToLRVsUz83go_cHy0LsyA.text: Horrible experience here. This is unfortunate because we have been here before and had a positive experience. Our food took almost 45 minutes to come out. Nobody communicated that it would be a lengthy wait until we asked to speak to the manager. 2 of us ordered the fried chicken which was not seasoned well. My poor husband ordered salmon which was over cooked. When the food finally came out 2 of our sides were missing. When we got the sides they we're disappointing as well. The steamed broccoli was not good at all and tasted like burned butter. The manager took a small amount off of our check but the meal should have been at least half off. Needless to say we will not be back.

Lf4nF-XOZtjA3xAN2ZogOw.text: Stopped in to check out the new location...love the decor and open feel to this location! Grabbed a drink and a bite at the bar- the bartenders are super nice and very knowledgeable. The pretzel bites are my go to fav!

EUmA1cKDpiou6mtuZ4tS3w.text: Delicious chicken and waffles with eggs...enjoyed the atmosphere as well. Made it just in time for brunch. The mimosas were good too.

duWoWXLkKacS0MnVUA_mTA.text: Sara was an amazing server, food came out great. Perfect experience all around! Buffalo chicken sandwich was great.

7q8BiArgDfsISRqimh2txQ.text: A total 180 from the Cotswold location. We came here for a birthday dinner and had the worst experience at a Leroy Fox to-date.   The service was slow and unattentive (it was a slow Sunday night) and our food was delivered incorrectly. We ordered the salmon with honey glaze and was brought just the salmon. We informed them that this was incorrect and they brought out a cup of the honey glaze and was told: "I know this is not what you ordered but here you go."  Needless to say, I'm probably never coming back to this place.

ZE2K_RCQkx-20b3A15DbWw.text: This is a great place to go to watch football.  Not too crowded, great food and drink choices, and never too crowded.  The service at the bar can be a bit slow - I suggest sitting at a table.

bqv774RoHcBsC0--dKgPAg.text: First time at this location. I loved everything about it. The food was absolutely delicious. The waiter was awesome and always checked on us. Everyone in the Birthday party liked their food. I got the fried chicken, Brussels sprouts and cornbread. Hey were cooked to perfection. My friends loved the mac and cheese, shrimp wrap, beets salad and the wings. We definitely plan to come back soon.

Q2Oi4tlM39nQmhliZHzh9g.text: I love the Cotswold location but South hasn't really impressed. I've ordered take out from here twice and both times it's been ok. This time I ordered salmon, Brussels  sprouts and mashed potatoes. The salmon was just ok and the Brussels sprouts were burnt to a crisp and tasted WAY to salty. Will probably just stick with the Cotswold location.

dg32TQH7yZukOLIIUvoXAg.text: I have been to this location a few times now. The food, drinks, and service are all consistently great. If you haven't been, definitely try the fried chicken.

AQbxPCY9EbLlXbRLinZ_Yg.text: I was somewhat disappointed that my Brussels sprouts were undercooked and very hard, But the Fried chicken was excellent.  I will of course try Leroy Fox one more time, but at the other location and hope for a better dining experience.

ZdF6YjVaJxcmXDmdXjAANA.text: Love the honey buffalo chicken salad as a wrap. Usually hang at the bar and service is always excellent.

bRbobT6slSQya0TIrFLLzg.text: Eh. Was hoping for a really good brunch but it was just okay.  I liked the options but everything that came out (except the fried food) was cold; especially the grits. Not sure I'd go back. Daddy didn't even finish his and he loves French toast.

Z11odWCjnXO8euhcxkcUtQ.text: Despite the cute decor and hip vibe, I found Leroy Fox to be underwhelming due to the slow service. I came for dinner with a few coworkers around 7:30 pm on a Wednesday night. Our food finally arrived to our table at 8:25 pm. Overall, the food was decent (personal favorite was the brussel sprouts), but not remarkable enough to merit the wait time. There are plenty of similar dinner options all around Charlotte, so Leroy doesn't stand out to me.

ajAo1f2Xazz8BHF1QgeKuQ.text: Came here with my sister. Had a Kentucky mule and fish and chips. It was pretty good. It was Memorial Day weekend so it was pretty busy which led to the kitchen being backed up which meant our food took a while to get to the table.  It's a really nice spot with a patio seating area as well. Lots of TVs so it's great for the NBA Finals. Drinks are OK.

s_T663FErcSnOZcjxRdifQ.text: Came here not too long after they opened, and just like the other location, the sweet potato tots are dank! It's my favorite thing on the menu haha!   The vibe is a little different here than at the other location though. It's a very open space with a patio that opens into the restaurant via a big garage door type window. We sat at a table inside near the bar and were seated right away on a Friday night which was nice. The space was slightly cramped with full tables all around us, but it didn't detract from the experience. There were also plenty of tvs, so it would be a great place to go on gameday.  I was trying to be healthy so I ordered the Roasted Beet Salad. I was very impressed with the size of it and I was so full that I barely finished it! The fried beets, avocados, and pickled red onions were plentiful on top of the bed of greens.   Drink-wise, the boo and I started with their Cucumber Basil Lemonade , which we thought was very refreshing and just the right hint of sweetness. Wanting to try something else, we then ordered another drink, the Alexa, and were not enthused as it did not have much flavor. We told the waitress and she asked if we wanted to change it out for the lemonade again.. we agreed and she also comped us the drink!  The service was great and the food was plentiful. I'm excited to come back!

kMkbuEipKFW-vkCb4ZJUZg.text: Absolutely love the food here but the service is hit or miss. I've never had an absolutely terrible experience, but even during slow times (with 75% of tables empty) it can take forever to get seated, get drinks, etc. Also they can tend to give really inaccurate takeout pickup times - I get that this happens sometimes, but they range from 10 minutes early - 20 minutes late and it never seems to be ready when they say! Definitely think the Cotswold location shines when it comes to service, but LOVE the food and atmosphere at both - just work on the service please!

FLLUZ8wMuz_1HL5VmyQXEw.text: Just had Leroy Fox's for lunch. This was my first time here at their second (and new) location. I came for lunch around 12:45 and it wasn't crowded at all. This is a perfect spot for a meal, and literally one block from the East/West light rail station.   I'm glad we picked this place. The atmosphere was great. We sat outside on their nice patio. Cool Charlotte-specific wall art, which I always appreciate. Music inside was good- good music makes the atmosphere 10x better in my opinion. The bar was clean and they have lots of TVs, so I'm sure this would be a great place to watch the Panthers.   I got a buffalo chicken salad; my friend got the roasted beet salad. They were both excellent and a good size. Also- the sweet potato tots are probably the best in Charlotte.   Our service was great, she was attentive and nice.   I will start recommending Leroy Fox's in SE to my friends who live down here!

rjJUTO4tHZCKTjeq67h3ww.text: I really enjoyed this place and to be honest, probably would have never stopped in myself. My friend and I were looking for a place to grab a drink and decided we didn't want to walk the mile and a half in our heels. We happened to be right outside of Leroy's and ducked in for a quick drink. To my surprise, this place is so cute! I love the decorations and the place is large, which also makes it hard to hear when it's busy. What I loved most is that they have a small private room that you can reserve for larger parties. It even comes with it's own tv's. I will definitely be reserving this room for future events and will also be back to get drinks at the bar.

saWqvvLvDOKfmUGy6_RHNw.text: Such a cool place in the heart of South End! Although I only had wine, the craft cocktails look amazing! We ordered the Zucchini fries and it was really good. I was there for happy hour and there was a nice crowd. Our server was very personable but he was a little in the weeds.

ECP7SvShperx0TliCnk7Ow.text: Decided on Leroy Fox due to its location and the fact that menu sounded good. Food was very good. All hot and tasty. Had Zucchini Fries, 1/2 North Homestyle Fried Chicken and shared Bread Pudding. Enjoyed all. My only negative was the wait time. This was early Sunday evening and it was mostly empty.  We all just drank the water served but they said twice they would bring out the 6th glass that was missing. Finally had to ask another server. Dinner seemed to take an excessively long time.   Also they plated something incorrectly but they did fix it quickly.   I would give it another try just because of the food.

QNOXF3zdgTCVs2uORdBrmg.text: Atmosphere is great. However the chicken and waffles had zero flavor. Probably come back and try the Lunch/Dinner menu

ZO5E0lN62E0c4cSoJEAg6Q.text: Let's talk about Adam Gautreau - are you looking for someone that can read your mind and craft a cocktail that is the best you've ever had? He's your man!   Come in and see Adam and all the bartenders. The bar is always a blast.

IAtgduollzyGkuWpI4vcGQ.text: I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and assume that maybe because I was wearing a green army field jacket that perhaps they didn't see me standing inside their restaurant waiting to be seated. So I went to the restroom and when I returned my wife was still standing still not acknowledged (FYI she was not wearing a green field jacket)    I couldn't help but asking the bartenders/servers, "excuse me, are you guys open" in my most sarcastic tone possible and it went right over her empty little head. I asked for some menus because no one in the restaurant knows how to greet customers apparently.   We took our own seats and studied the over priced menu for a few minutes before deciding we weren't giving our money to a restaurant like this. We grabbed our jackets and hit the exit!   You'd think they'd make an effort to find out why two customers are walking out before even ordering, but that would be giving them too much credit. This place flat out SUCKS! And the staff is inattentive and lack customer service skills.

3c85zC6d3lkK5e9RtXs9uw.text: Leroy fox is a sweet place to hang. Good atmosphere and enjoyable place. The one in South End is right by the light rail and in a prime spot. The food is good! Some stuff could probably be done a little better but overall it's a good spot. They are best known for their chicken and I agree! Everything chicken wise I've had has been great. Bar menu also on point! Great spot!

8qYJn5qmutzlnysT0GKECg.text: I love the location of this restaurant.  Located on a chic side of town.  We arrived right before the crowd and got a great spot.  However, this place gets packed and it's not really a large place.  The bar sits in the middle and then you have the tables and booths surrounding it.  It was very noisy and the bar is very close to the tables so while some people were gathered around the bar waiting on their table, it seemed very crowded and small.  But nonetheless, we are here for the food.  So I signed up for their rewards program (which I highly recommend because you get to try their zucchini fries for free ---- I mean the breading was delicious and seasoned but unless you are a huge zucchini fan then I'm not sure these are for you, but for free, why not).  So I ordered the Shrimp Po boy and it was really good --- seasoning on point!  Their cajun fries were good as well.  My guy ordered the chicken buffalo sandwich and it was good and spicy with a side of sweet potato tots and the fact that I don't eat sweet potato fries/tots whatever, those were pretty darn good!!!  Lastly the folks ordered their famous chicken and again, it was the same batter on the chicken, shrimp and zucchini fries and when I tell you...it was finger-licking good. We didn't try their cocktails, but next time I will definitely order one and try something else on their menu but definitely thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cucumber drank
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Zucchini Fries (free when you sign up with their app)

KLG6GzeWv0u268Ni24Yzmw.text: Come hungry! Leave STUFFED   We've been to Leroy Fox South End a few times, and have really enjoyed each experience. Both brunch and dinner were very tasty. I tried the shrimp wrap (with grilled shrimp) on a recommendation from our waitress. She did not steer me wrong, it is delicious! Their brussel sprout side is killer too.  As far as the brunch menu, my husband highly recommends the hash brown casserole. It's rich and decadent- the kind of thing you want to take a nap after but really should go work out for like 2 hours.  Our only complaint is service related. While all of our servers have been very nice, the coordination with the bar seems to constantly be an issue. We've been 3 times now and each time a drink was forgotten or took over 15-20 minutes to arrive. The cocktails are super yummy (champagne mojito!) If only you could consistently get them to your table.  To be fair, the servers have been very apologetic and immediately try tor make things right, but it seems something should be improved in their work flow.

Lk-qiM52FGB8UTG9nsDAyQ.text: This place was fantastic. The only reason for the 4 is due to the broccoli. We started with the nachos. Our main meal was the National fried chicken with Mac n cheese and broccoli. Pass on that if you go. We received ours in a bowl of water and over cooked. Everything else was delicious.

fWNr9lVfw_wHRqvvFc_ZHw.text: Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm, Have you ever had a meal that was so good you didn't want it to end? That was my experience today at Leroy Fox. I think I made love to each forkful. I didn't even eat it all because I wanted more when I got home. The fried chicken, juicy, flavorful and crunchy! This is the signature for a reason folks! The brussel sprouts, seasoned so well. The mac and cheese was even good and I did not have high expectations about it when it got to the table. And the tollhouse dessert...can you see my eyes rolling in the back of my head? Homemade caramel sauce, perfectly baked warm cookie...my only complaint was I wish it were bigger. I was so impressed and wondering why it took me so long to get there! I can not wait to go back! I have found another favorite!

Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. So good!!

E7FReceEzG-U87Av8ln9kg.text: Seriously the best friend chicken I've had in a very long time. I got the Cajun fries but I should have got the Brussels sprout or cheese grits. The service and atmosphere was super comfortable. They are doing a great job here!

HqkHLFVVg_FEnxi7LIE8Vw.text: Went their on a Sunday around 6/7, sat down at a table and ordered beers (which took about 15 minutes) before they decided to tell us their kitchen was closed...  10 minutes later they come back and say, just kidding, kitchen is open. So we ordered food. Food was average, nothing too special and one of our sides came out wrong.  Maybe I'll give this place the benefit of the doubt and try it again...

2sAN1T6V8gZ9AURnH5KgiA.text: This is a cute place near downtown Charlotte. We came around 3:30PM on a Saturday and got seated immediately. The service was not the greatest, which is the only reason they're not getting 5 stars. Our server disappeared for 30 minutes and seemed too busy. The food was REALLY good. I had the buffalo chicken salad and it was perfect. The buffalo vinaigrette was soooooo good. I loved this dish and I'll be back to get it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

1wnyB88u1TXRRWBNCqIA3Q.text: Leroy fox is one of our go to places. I am obsessed w the fried zucchini. The fried chicken is 2nd to the zucchini its seriously that good. We generally sit at the bar and get served fast.

K_phN8NIEDXV61gjrjb3OQ.text: I tried it out because it was in a convienent location and was pleasantly surprised.  We were seated quickly and the service was great.    The sweet potatoes tots are glorious! All of the food we had was good and I liked the ambience an could definitely see myself coming back for a date or a girls night.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. The banana pudding was so yummy!
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. The nachos.  You get a ton for the price.
Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits.  I like a little more kick, but it was really good and filling.

bnRUWnatrgZx1UrFEw-3XA.text: I love love love this place. All the sides were delicious. Fried chicken were piping hot, golden brown and delicious. Sweet potato tots are my recommended side dish. If you're a Brussels sprouts fan, you can't go wrong with the Brussels sprouts

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

5vjHqMcF6MOYGPYAlK2GSg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Everything on their menu is delicious. I come here quite often and I've never had one bad meal! The only thing is service can be a bit slow at times, but to me the wait is worth it! The seats are comfortable and the decor is fun!

08U7o4SspT50mzGJbvlIXg.text: Great southern cuisine, but a little modern flare.  Great fried chicken.  Please try the hash brown casserole...OMG.  Brunch here is awesome... a little hair of the dog mixed with some good wholesome southern breakfast .  I like the omelets!  The wife loves the chicken biscuit !  I've eaten here at least 5 times and have never had a bad meal.

j51LP_HX2MWvxb6EW1k3BQ.text: This place is delicious and cozy.   My boy friend and I came here for a Sunday night dinner. It was a beautiful 75 night so we sat on the patio. It had lights hung above with wood furniture and TVs. They put on the Cavs playoff game for us CLE natives! We wanted some local NC beer so our waiter recommended the Juicy Jay which was very flavorful and light. I ordered the 1/4 North with a side of mac & cheese and my boy friend ordered the BBQ sandwich with a side of mashed potatoes and sausage gravy. Both were so good, especially the mac & cheese. The chicken was very crispy and the cheese was very cheesy.  This is a prefect place for a nice summer dinner!

SyBZLckXW0JCljMctU9hRw.text: Food was awesome! I order the Chicken Club with Honey Buffalo. The grilled chicken was moist with lots of flavor. We also order Zucchini fries and they were amazing with a little bit of spicy to the batter. Cooper our waiter was absolutely wonderful with the service and information about the menu My parents order the fried chicken and there are no words to describe the flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox - South End - Charlotte, NC, United States

UC_HD8bQ6GKWlJ0OZSBnJQ.text: We've been to the location in South Park area and my husband loves their fried chicken. Recently we decided to try this new location. We didn't love the mac and cheese or the green bean casserole but we should've just stuck with the sides we normally get. Overall, though, our main items were great. Service was also great. Drinks were awesome. We will be back!

Dx32ydxQXvyjfpeBInSAwQ.text: The food was awesome!! There were some hiccups but the service was awesome in the end was some of the best!! Will for sure find a way to come back to the city just for this PLACE!!!!!!!

zixpml7RjKaBfWXswIj8zw.text: I'ts really sad that I have to write this, but last night was my fourth and final visit to Leroy Fox southend location. I had previously posted and then deleted my review because I hate writing bad reviews (I have only every written one bad review on yelp) because I am a big believer in "if you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all." But I feel like with my experience last night and as a fellow business owner that it's necessary. I absolutely love the food and the Cotswold location, but I feel like I've been left with a sour taste in my mouth and struggle to want to support this place any longer (not like they won't survive without my business) The first time my boyfriend and I visited LF Southend we were having drinks at the bar- service was a little slow, but we figured that since they were newly open, they were working out the kinks. Second time, service was just as slow, and our service was mediocre- we were waiting 20 minutes before being served drinks, and my boyfriend had ordered an entree only to have the side come out so late that he was done with his main portion. Sucks, but we said hey, if we have plans, we don't need to come here to eat. 3rd time I ordered food to go- I was able to finish 3 drinks at the bar before my food was finished, and even then, they thought they had messed up my order before I left.  All of these I can maybe put to the side but last night, my boyfriend and I stopped in after watching the football game (around 7pm). We were seated at a table and waited about 5-10 minutes and weren't approached. Mind you, the restaurant was not busy. We finally said forget it, then left. As we were walking away, a server stepped outside and yelled "thanks for coming in!" In what seemed like a very sarcastic tone. I had to ask my boyfriend if I was hearing things right but he also felt the same way about the comment. Why was this necessary? And even if it was genuine, it was a little too late to save face.   I really hate to say this, but I won't be returning to this location any longer. As a business owner in southend, I would often refer clients to this spot for lunch- but I won't be doing this either  Update/ I was reached out to by one of the managers of all of the locations after a client of mine who works there informed him of my review- he was kind enough to give me a very sincere apology and phone call and supplied my staff with lunch to make Amends. Thank you to Brandon for taking action and I hope to return to the southend location for a better experience. The food, as always, was great.

IfziVDoDvZgjiHqyG8lAvw.text: 4.5! This restaurant was awesome. The decor was so well done, and we sat outside to enjoy the weather but I can see us hanging at the bar for a date night some time. For lunch I had the pimento/egg fried chicken sandwich and mashed potatoes with sausage gravy. OOoooo the mashed potatoes. I'm a snob and they were SO good. The sausage was very flavorful without being too salty. The sandwich was very tasty but I think the fried chicken would have been a bit bland and dry if it weren't for the toppings. I'll have to go back to double check that . My husband got the buffalo fried chicken sandwich and he said it was great as well. We can't wait to try more of the menu here.

PeGtDDtVi1OdEPRiwoj-dw.text: We stopped in to catch the cavs game and to grab a quick bite. There was a wait for a table so we sat at the bar. I ordered the wings and zucchini fries. As did the other two ladies I was with. We aren't from the area so I was looking forward to some great fried chicken.. and they delivered!! The bartender who took care of us was friendly, personable and overall great! The chicken was amazing, spicy and super juicy. I do wish the zucchini fries were a bit smaller. I only got 4 in an order and they were massive! Although delicious, smaller fries would've made for a better bite. I love the decor here! Kind of artsy meets rustic, the mural on the wall is amazing and I enjoyed the overall look. My drink was spicy and had an awesome ice sphere in it with jalapenos frozen inside! I  definitely return.

FL5DATPb8tdRmzA7MXAJOw.text: I will never go to Leroy Fox SE again. This was our second time here and our experience was so bad it prompted me to write a review. Our first at the restaurant the appetizer didn't come out until after our meal. The manager came out and apologized and comped the app, which seemed appropriate. Second visit , we ordered an app and our meal at the same time. App came out no problem but we sat there for 40 minutes after the app came out and no meal. I mentioned something to the server and the management addressed by doing absolutely nothing. The Meal finally came out, mind you we ordered one entree and 2 sides, it was decent food but the wait was inexcusable. The table beside us had sat after us and had already finished their food and cashed out by the time we got ours. My guess is they don't really care about returning customers so I'll bring my money elsewhere.

VfrhuptxLEOdh9UmbJmsHQ.text: The star rating is for service. The food there is excellent! I've eaten in the restaurant and called ahead to pick up an order and every time my meal was amazing. They need to do a much better job training their staff. It seems like they turn over servers every 3 month. In addition, the servers get quickly overwhelmed and forget to check on your table or orders seem to take way longer than they should. When I sit at a table, I would totally drink more if the server was attentive and checked up when my drinks are empty. I also always order ranch with the sweet potato tots... they have their own sauce that they serve. But imo they're WAY better with ranch! And every time the kitchen forgets to include my ranch. Well... one time they remembered. But that's because I was sitting at the bar. You get much better service sitting and eating at the bar.  The bartenders are attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and they don't seem to have as high of a turnover rate.
